  6876                                  
  6877                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6878                                  
  6879                                  ; 18/10/2022
  6880                                  ; 15/10/2022
  6881                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0						
  6882                                  ;								 
  6883                                  ;	link next bds (at ds:di) into the chain. assume that the
  6884                                  ;	  chain is entirely within ds == datagrp. also update drvmax,
  6885                                  ;	  dskdrv_table, and end_of_bdss.	
  6886                                  
  6887                                  xinstall_bds:		
  6888 000021DD 56                      		push	si
  6889 000021DE 53                      		push	bx
  6890 000021DF 8B36[1901]              		mov	si, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  6891                                  xinstall_bds_1:				
  6892 000021E3 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; is this the last one?
  6893 000021E6 7404                    		jz	short xinstall_bds_2 ;	skip ahead if so
  6894                                  		;mov	si, [si+BDS.link]
  6895 000021E8 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; chain	through	list
  6896 000021EA EBF7                    		jmp	short xinstall_bds_1
  6897                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6898                                  
  6899                                  xinstall_bds_2:				
  6900                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link], di
  6901 000021EC 893C                    		mov	[si], di
  6902                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link+2], ds
  6903 000021EE 8C5C02                  		mov	[si+2], ds
  6904                                  		;mov	word [di+BDS.link], -1
  6905 000021F1 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; make sure it is a null ptr.
  6906                                  		;mov	[di+BDS.link+2], ds
  6907 000021F5 8C5D02                  		mov	[di+2], ds ; might as well plug segment
  6908                                  		; 20/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6909                                  		;lea	bx, [di+BDS.BPB]
  6910 000021F8 8D5D06                  		lea	bx, [di+6]
  6911 000021FB 8B36[4417]              		mov	si, [last_dskdrv_table]
  6912 000021FF 891C                    		mov	[si], bx
  6913 00002201 8306[4417]02            		add	word [last_dskdrv_table], 2
  6914 00002206 FE06[7500]              		inc	byte [drvmax]
  6915 0000220A 8306[4617]64            		add	word [end_of_bdss], 100 ; BDS.size = 100
  6916 0000220F 5B                      		pop	bx
  6917 00002210 5E                      		pop	si
  6918 00002211 C3                      		retn
  6919                                  
  6920                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6921                                  
  6922                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6923                                  ; 15/10/2022
  6924                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6925                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  6926                                  
  6927                                  cmos_clock_read:	
  6928 00002212 50                      		push	ax
  6929 00002213 51                      		push	cx
  6930 00002214 52                      		push	dx
  6931 00002215 55                      		push	bp
  6932 00002216 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  6933                                  loop_clock:				
  6934 00002218 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  6935 0000221A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6936 0000221C B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  6937 0000221E CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6938                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  6939                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  6940                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  6941 00002220 83F900                  		cmp	cx, 0
  6942 00002223 7512                    		jnz	short clock_present
  6943 00002225 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6944 00002228 750D                    		jnz	short clock_present
  6945 0000222A 83FD01                  		cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  6946 0000222D 741C                    		jz	short no_readdate ; was	at zero	setting.
  6947 0000222F 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  6948 00002230 B90040                  		mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  6949                                  delay:					
  6950 00002233 E2FE                    		loop	delay
  6951 00002235 EBE1                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  6952                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6953                                  
  6954                                  clock_present:				
  6955 00002237 2EC606[F304]01          		mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  6956 0000223D E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  6957                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  6958                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  6959 00002240 56                      		push	si
  6960 00002241 E8E5F2                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  6961 00002244 FA                      		cli
  6962                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  6963 00002245 8936[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  6964 00002249 FB                      		sti
  6965 0000224A 5E                      		pop	si
  6966                                  
  6967                                  no_readdate:				
  6968 0000224B 5D                      		pop	bp
  6969 0000224C 5A                      		pop	dx
  6970 0000224D 59                      		pop	cx
  6971 0000224E 58                      		pop	ax
  6972 0000224F C3                      		retn
  6973                                  
  6974                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6975                                  
  6976                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  6977                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  6978                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  6979                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  6980                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  6981                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  6982                                  ;
  6983                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  6984                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  6985                                  ;
  6986                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  6987                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  6988                                  ;
  6989                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  6990                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  6991                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initilization routine
  6992                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  6993                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  6994                                  ;
  6995                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  6996                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  6997                                  
  6998                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits	
  6999                                  
  7000                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  7001                                  
  7002                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7003                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  7004                                  			
  7005 00002250 50                      		push	ax
  7006 00002251 2E803E[3E06]FC          		cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  7007 00002257 7525                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  7008 00002259 2E803E[3F06]06          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  7009                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  7010 0000225F 7408                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS	periodic rate if 06
  7011 00002261 2E803E[3F06]04          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  7012                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  7013 00002267 7315                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST  
  7014                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0 
  7015                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  7016                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE 
  7017                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06 
  7018                                  cmosck4:				
  7019 00002269 B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  7020                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7021 0000226B B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  7022                                  					; Set divider &	rate selection
  7023 0000226D E83000                  		call	cmos_write
  7024 00002270 B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  7025                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7026 00002272 E80B00                  		call	cmos_read
  7027 00002275 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  7028                                  					; clear	SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  7029 00002277 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  7030 00002279 B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  7031                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  7032 0000227B E82200                  		call	cmos_write
  7033                                  cmosck9:				
  7034 0000227E 58                      		pop	ax
  7035 0000227F C3                      		retn
  7036                                  
  7037                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7038                                  
  7039                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  7040                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7041                                  ;									       :
  7042                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
  7043                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7044                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
  7045                                  ;									       :
  7046                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
  7047                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled.  during the cmos read both nmi and  :
  7048                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7049                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7050                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7051                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7052                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7053                                  
  7054                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)	
  7055 00002280 9C                      		pushf
  7056 00002281 FA                      		cli
  7057 00002282 53                      		push	bx
  7058 00002283 50                      		push	ax		; AL = cmos table address to be	read
  7059 00002284 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
  7060 00002286 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7061                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7062 00002288 90                      		nop			; (undocumented	delay needed)
  7063 00002289 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7064 0000228B 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax
  7065 0000228D 58                      		pop	ax
  7066 0000228E 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7067 00002290 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7068 00002292 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7069                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7070 00002294 90                      		nop
  7071 00002295 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7072 00002297 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  7073 00002299 5B                      		pop	bx
  7074 0000229A 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7075 0000229B E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7076 0000229E C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
  7077                                  
  7078                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7079                                  
  7080                                  cmos_popf:				
  7081 0000229F CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
  7082                                  					; return far and restore flags
  7083                                  
  7084                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7085                                  
  7086                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  7087                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7088                                  ;									       :
  7089                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  7090                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7091                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  7092                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  7093                                  ;									       :
  7094                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  7095                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  7096                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7097                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7098                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7099                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7100                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7101                                  
  7102                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)	
  7103 000022A0 9C                      		pushf			; write (ah) to location (al)
  7104 000022A1 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  7105 000022A2 FA                      		cli
  7106 000022A3 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  7107 000022A4 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  7108 000022A6 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7109                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7110 000022A8 90                      		nop
  7111 000022A9 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  7112 000022AB E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7113 000022AD 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  7114 000022AE 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7115 000022B0 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7116 000022B2 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7117                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7118 000022B4 90                      		nop
  7119 000022B5 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7120 000022B7 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  7121 000022B8 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7122 000022B9 E8E3FF                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7123 000022BC C3                      		retn
  7124                                  
  7125                                  ; 21/12/2022
  7126                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7127                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7128                                  %if 0
  7129                                  
  7130                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7131                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7132                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7133                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
  7134                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7135                                  
  7136                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7137                                  ;
  7138                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
  7139                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
  7140                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
  7141                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
  7142                                  
  7143                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7144                                  
  7145                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
  7146                                  ;
  7147                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
  7148                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
  7149                                  ;  es:di = load location
  7150                                  
  7151                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7152                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7153                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7154                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
  7155                                  
  7156                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7157                                  getclus:				
  7158                                  		push	cx
  7159                                  		push	di
  7160                                  		mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7161                                  		mov	ax, bx
  7162                                  		dec	ax
  7163                                  		dec	ax
  7164                                  		mul	cx		; convert to logical sector
  7165                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
  7166                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
  7167                                  		add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
  7168                                  		adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  7169                                  unpack:					
  7170                                  		push	ds
  7171                                  		push	ax
  7172                                  		push	bx
  7173                                  		mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
  7174                                  		mov	ds, si
  7175                                  		mov	si, bx		; next cluster
  7176                                  		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
  7177                                  					; 16 bit fat?
  7178                                  		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
  7179                                  		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si=si/2
  7180                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
  7181                                  		add	si, bx		;
  7182                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
  7183                                  		push	dx
  7184                                  		xor	dx, dx
  7185                                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7186                                  		pop	dx
  7187                                  		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
  7188                                  		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
  7189                                  		; 25/06/2023
  7190                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
  7191                                  		mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
  7192                                  		inc	si		; (next	byte)
  7193                                  		push	dx
  7194                                  		xor	dx, dx
  7195                                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7196                                  		pop	dx
  7197                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
  7198                                  		mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
  7199                                  		mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
  7200                                  		mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
  7201                                  even_odd:				
  7202                                  		pop	bx		; restore old fat entry	value
  7203                                  		push	bx		; save it right	away.
  7204                                  		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
  7205                                  		jnb	short havclus	; it was even.
  7206                                  		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
  7207                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
  7208                                  		shr	ax, 1
  7209                                  		shr	ax, 1
  7210                                  		shr	ax, 1
  7211                                  havclus:				
  7212                                  		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
  7213                                  		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
  7214                                  		jmp	short unpackx
  7215                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7216                                  
  7217                                  unpack16:				
  7218                                  		push	dx
  7219                                  		xor	dx, dx
  7220                                  		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
  7221                                  		adc	dx, 0
  7222                                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7223                                  		pop	dx
  7224                                  		mov	bx, [bx]	;
  7225                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
  7226                                  unpackx:				
  7227                                  		pop	si		; restore old bx value into si
  7228                                  		pop	ax		; restore logical sector (low)
  7229                                  		pop	ds
  7230                                  		sub	si, bx
  7231                                  		cmp	si, -1		; one apart?
  7232                                  		jnz	short getcl2
  7233                                  		add	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7234                                  		jmp	short unpack
  7235                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7236                                  
  7237                                  getcl2:					
  7238                                  		push	bx
  7239                                  		push	dx		; sector to read (high)
  7240                                  		push	ax		; sector to read (low)
  7241                                  		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  7242                                  		mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
  7243                                  		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
  7244                                  		pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
  7245                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
  7246                                  		push	ds
  7247                                  		push	cs
  7248                                  		pop	ds
  7249                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7250                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7251                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7252                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7253                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7254                                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
  7255                                  		pop	ds
  7256                                  		pop	bx
  7257                                  		pop	di
  7258                                  		mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
  7259                                  		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
  7260                                  		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
  7261                                  		add	di, ax		; update load location
  7262                                  		pop	cx		; restore sectors/cluster
  7263                                  		retn
  7264                                  
  7265                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7266                                  
  7267                                  
  7268                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
  7269                                  ;
  7270                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
  7271                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
  7272                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
  7273                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
  7274                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
  7275                                  ;
  7276                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  7277                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
  7278                                  ;      other registera saved.
  7279                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
  7280                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  7281                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  7282                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
  7283                                  
  7284                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7285                                  get_fat_sector:	
  7286                                  		push	ax
  7287                                  		push	cx
  7288                                  		push	di
  7289                                  		push	si
  7290                                  		push	es
  7291                                  		push	ds
  7292                                  		mov	ax, si
  7293                                  		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7294                                  		div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
  7295                                  		nop
  7296                                  
  7297                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
  7298                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
  7299                                  
  7300                                  		push	es
  7301                                  		push	ds
  7302                                  		push	di
  7303                                  		push	ax
  7304                                  		push	cs
  7305                                  		pop	ds
  7306                                  
  7307                                  		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
  7308                                  		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
  7309                                  		;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
  7310                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
  7311                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7312                                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
  7313                                  		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
  7314                                  		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
  7315                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
  7316                                  		pop	di
  7317                                  		pop	ds
  7318                                  		pop	es
  7319                                  		cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
  7320                                  		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
  7321                                  		mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax 
  7322                                  					; sector number
  7323                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
  7324                                  		push	dx
  7325                                  		mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
  7326                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
  7327                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
  7328                                  		mov	dx, ax
  7329                                  		mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
  7330                                  		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
  7331                                  		push	ds
  7332                                  		pop	es
  7333                                  		xor	di, di		; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
  7334                                  		push	ds
  7335                                  		push	cs
  7336                                  		pop	ds
  7337                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7338                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7339                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7340                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7341                                  		call	call_bios_code
  7342                                  		pop	ds
  7343                                  		pop	dx
  7344                                  		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7345                                  
  7346                                  gfs_split_chk:				
  7347                                  		dec	cx		; 511
  7348                                  		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
  7349                                  					; last byte of this sector,
  7350                                  					; then splitted	entry.
  7351                                  		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
  7352                                  		pop	ds
  7353                                  		pop	es
  7354                                  		pop	si
  7355                                  		pop	di
  7356                                  		pop	cx
  7357                                  		pop	ax
  7358                                  		retn
  7359                                  
  7360                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7361                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
  7362                                  
  7363                                  %endif
  7364                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7365                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7366                                  
  7367                                  		; 09/12/2022
  7368                                  		;db 0
  7369                                  
  7370                                  numbertodiv	equ ($-BData_start)
  7371                                  numbertomod	equ (numbertodiv % 16)
  7372                                  
  7373                                  %if numbertomod>0 & numbertomod<16
  7374 000022BD 00<rep 3h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
  7375                                  %endif
  7376                                  
  7377                                  ;align 16
  7378                                  
  7379                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7380                                  IOSYSCODESEGOFF	equ $ - BData_start
  7381                                  IOSYSCODESEG	equ (IOSYSCODESEGOFF>>4)+(700h>>4)
  7382                                  
  7383                                  ;--- End of DOSBIOS data segment --------------------------------------------
  7384                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7385                                  		;db 4 dup(0)
  7386                                  ; 09/12/2022		
  7387                                  ;		times 4 db 0	; 19/10/2022
  7388                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7389                                  
  7390                                  ;============================================================================
  7391                                  ; DOS BIOS (IO.SYS) CODE SEGMENT 
  7392                                  ;============================================================================
  7393                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7394                                  
  7395                                  section .BIOSCODE vstart=0  
  7396                                  
  7397                                  BCode_start:	 ; 09/12/2022
  7398                                   
  7399                                  ; 02/10/2022
  7400                                  
  7401                                  ;--- DOSBIOS code segment ---------------------------------------------------
  7402                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7403                                  ; MSBIO1.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7404                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7405                                  
  7406                                  DOSBIOSEG_2C7h:	;db 30h dup(0)		; SEGMENT 2C7h (2C70h-700h=2570h)
  7407 00000000 00<rep 30h>             		times 48 db 0		; 19/10/2022	
  7408 00000030 7000                    BiosDataWord:	dw 70h
  7409                                  
  7410                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7411                                  ;BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  7412                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7413                                  BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord
  7414                                  
  7415                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7416                                  
  7417                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) 
  7418                                  
  7419                                  ;************************************************************************
  7420                                  ;*									*
  7421                                  ;*	seg_reinit is called with ax = our new code segment value,	*
  7422                                  ;*	  trashes di, cx, es						*
  7423                                  ;*									*
  7424                                  ;*	cas -- should be made disposable!				*
  7425                                  ;*									*
  7426                                  ;************************************************************************
  7427                                  
  7428                                  _seg_reinit:
  7429 00000032 2E8E06[3000]            		mov	es, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
  7430                                  					; at 2C7h:30h or 70h:25A0h
  7431                                  		;mov	di, (offset cdev+2)
  7432 00000037 BF[E006]                		mov	di, cdev+2	; 19/10/2022
  7433 0000003A B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; (end_BC_entries - cdev)/4
  7434                                  
  7435                                  _seg_reinit_1:				
  7436 0000003D AB                      		stosw			; modify Bios_Code entry points
  7437 0000003E 47                      		inc	di
  7438 0000003F 47                      		inc	di
  7439 00000040 E2FB                    		loop	_seg_reinit_1
  7440 00000042 CB                      		retf
  7441                                  
  7442                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7443                                  
  7444                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7445                                  
  7446                                  ;************************************************************************
  7447                                  ;*									*
  7448                                  ;*	chardev_entry - main device driver dispatch routine		*
  7449                                  ;*	   called with a dummy parameter block on the stack		*
  7450                                  ;*	   dw dispatch_table, dw prn/aux numbers (optional)		*
  7451                                  ;*									*
  7452                                  ;*	will eventually take care of doing the transitions in		*
  7453                                  ;*	   out of Bios_Code						*
  7454                                  ;*									*
  7455                                  ;************************************************************************
  7456                                  
  7457                                  chardev_entry:				; 0070h:25B3h =	02C7h:0043h
  7458 00000043 56                      		push	si
  7459 00000044 50                      		push	ax
  7460 00000045 51                      		push	cx
  7461 00000046 52                      		push	dx
  7462 00000047 57                      		push	di
  7463 00000048 55                      		push	bp
  7464 00000049 1E                      		push	ds
  7465 0000004A 06                      		push	es
  7466 0000004B 53                      		push	bx
  7467 0000004C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
  7468 0000004E 8B7612                  		mov	si, [bp+18]	; get return address (dispatch table)
  7469                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
  7470                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  7471 00000051 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  7472 00000056 8B4402                  		mov	ax, [si+2]	; get the device number	if present
  7473 00000059 A2[2100]                		mov	[auxnum], al
  7474 0000005C 8826[E704]              		mov	[printdev], ah
  7475 00000060 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; point	to the device dispatch table
  7476 00000062 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; get pointer to i/o packet
  7477 00000066 268A4701                		mov	al, [es:bx+1]	; [es:bx+unit]	; al = unit code
  7478 0000006A 268A670D                		mov	ah, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+media]	; ah = media descrip
  7479 0000006E 268B4F12                		mov	cx, [es:bx+18]	; [es:bx+count]	; cx = count
  7480 00000072 268B5714                		mov	dx, [es:bx+20]	; [es:bx+start]	; dx = start sector
  7481                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7482 00000076 81FE[9604]              		cmp	si, DSKTBL
  7483                                  		;cmp	si, 4A2h	; dsktbl
  7484                                  					; at 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  7485 0000007A 7517                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  7486                                  
  7487                                  ; Special case for 32-bit start sector number:
  7488                                  ;   if (si==dsktbl) /* if this is a disk device call */
  7489                                  ;      set high 16 bits of secnum to 0
  7490                                  ;      if (secnum == 0xffff) fetch 32 bit sector number
  7491                                  ;
  7492                                  ; pass high word of sector number in start_sec_h, low word in dx
  7493                                  ;
  7494                                  ; note: start_l and start_h are the offsets within the io_request packet
  7495                                  ;	  which contain the low and hi words of the 32 bit start sector if
  7496                                  ;	  it has been used.
  7497                                  ;
  7498                                  ; note: remember not to destroy the registers which have been set up before
  7499                                  
  7500                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	0 ; initialize to 0
  7501 0000007C C706[2B05]0000          		mov	word [start_sec_h], 0
  7502 00000082 83FAFF                  		cmp	dx, 0FFFFh
  7503 00000085 750C                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  7504 00000087 268B571C                		mov	dx, [es:bx+28]	; [es:bx+start_h]
  7505                                  					; 32 bits dsk req
  7506                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	dx ; start_sec_h = packet.start_h
  7507 0000008B 8916[2B05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx
  7508 0000008F 268B571A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+26]	; [es:bx+start_l]
  7509                                  					; dx = packet.start_l
  7510                                  no_sector32_mapping:			
  7511 00000093 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  7512 00000094 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+cmd]
  7513 00000098 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, cs:[si]
  7514 0000009B 732C                    		jnb	short command_error
  7515 0000009D 98                      		cbw			; note that al <= 15 means ok
  7516 0000009E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  7517 000000A0 01C6                    		add	si, ax
  7518 000000A2 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  7519 000000A3 26C47F0E                		les	di, [es:bx+14]	; [es:bx+trans]
  7520 000000A7 FC                      		cld
  7521                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7522 000000A8 2EFF5401                		call	near [cs:si+1]
  7523                                  		;call	word ptr cs:si+1
  7524 000000AC 7202                    		jb	short already_got_ah_status
  7525 000000AE B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  7526                                  already_got_ah_status:
  7527                                  		;;mov	ds, [cs:0030h]	; 15/10/2022			
  7528                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  7529                                  					; cas note: shouldn't be needed!
  7530 000000B0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  7531                                  		;lds	bx, ds:ptrsav
  7532 000000B5 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]
  7533 000000B9 894703                  		mov	[bx+3],	ax	; [bx+status]
  7534                                  					; mark operation complete
  7535 000000BC 5B                      		pop	bx
  7536 000000BD 07                      		pop	es
  7537 000000BE 1F                      		pop	ds
  7538 000000BF 5D                      		pop	bp
  7539 000000C0 5F                      		pop	di
  7540 000000C1 5A                      		pop	dx
  7541 000000C2 59                      		pop	cx
  7542 000000C3 58                      		pop	ax
  7543 000000C4 5E                      		pop	si
  7544 000000C5 83C402                  		add	sp, 2		; get rid of fake return address
  7545                                  	
  7546                                  		; fall through into bc_retf
  7547                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------	
  7548                                  bc_retf:
  7549 000000C8 CB                      		retf
  7550                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7551                                  
  7552                                  command_error:				
  7553 000000C9 E80900                  		call	bc_cmderr
  7554 000000CC EBE2                    		jmp	short already_got_ah_status
  7555                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7556                                  ; 01/05/2019
  7557                                  
  7558                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7559                                  ; The following piece of hack is for supporting CP/M compatibility
  7560                                  ; Basically at offset 5 we have a far call into 0:c0. But this does not call
  7561                                  ; 0:c0 directly instead it call f01d:fef0, because it needs to support 'lhld 6'
  7562                                  ; The following hack has to reside at ffff:d0 (= f01d:fef0) if BIOS is loaded
  7563                                  ; high.
  7564                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7565                                  
  7566                                  		;db 7 dup(0)
  7567                                  
  7568                                  		; 15/10/2022
  7569                                  
  7570 000000CE 0000                    		dw 0		; pad to bring offset to 0D0h
  7571                                  
  7572 000000D0 00<rep 5h>              off_d0: 	times 5 db 0	; 5 bytes from 0:c0 will be copied onto here
  7573                                  				;  which is the CP/M call 5 entry point
  7574                                  		
  7575                                  
  7576                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7577                                  
  7578                                  ;	exit - all routines return through this path
  7579                                  
  7580                                  bc_cmderr:				
  7581 000000D5 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  7582                                  					; unknown command error
  7583                                  
  7584                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7585                                  
  7586                                  ;	now zero the count field by subtracting its current value,
  7587                                  ;	  which is still in cx, from itself.
  7588                                  
  7589                                  ;	subtract the number of i/o's NOT YET COMPLETED from total
  7590                                  ;	  in order to return the number actually complete
  7591                                  
  7592                                  bc_err_cnt:	
  7593                                  		;les	bx, ds:ptrsav
  7594                                  		; 19/10/2022
  7595 000000D7 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  7596 000000DB 26294F12                		sub	[es:bx+18], cx	; [es:bx+count]
  7597                                  					; # of successful i/o's
  7598 000000DF B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; mark error return
  7599 000000E1 F9                      		stc			; indicate abnormal end
  7600 000000E2 C3                      		retn
  7601                                  
  7602                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7603                                  
  7604                                  ;Bios_Code ends
  7605
