  8245                                  prn_query_err:
  8246                                  		; 12/12/2022				
  8247                                  		;stc
  8248 00000303 E9CFFD                  		jmp	bc_cmderr ; (bc_cmderr sets cf to 1)
  8249                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8250                                  
  8251                                  ;************************************************************************
  8252                                  ;*									*
  8253                                  ;*	aux port driver code -- "aux" == "com1"				*
  8254                                  ;*									*
  8255                                  ;*	the device driver entry/dispatch code sets up auxnum to		*
  8256                                  ;*	give the com port number to use (0=com1, 1=com2, 2=com3...)	*
  8257                                  ;*									*
  8258                                  ;************************************************************************
  8259                                  
  8260                                  ;	values in ah, requesting function of int 14h in rom bios
  8261                                  
  8262                                  ;auxfunc_send	 equ	1	;transmit
  8263                                  ;auxfunc_receive equ	2	;read
  8264                                  ;auxfunc_status	 equ	3	;request status
  8265                                  
  8266                                  ;	error flags, reported by int 14h, reported in ah:
  8267                                  
  8268                                  ;flag_data_ready equ	01h	;data ready
  8269                                  ;flag_overrun	 equ	02h	;overrun error
  8270                                  ;flag_parity	 equ	04h	;parity error
  8271                                  ;flag_frame	 equ	08h	;framing error
  8272                                  ;flag_break	 equ	10h	;break detect
  8273                                  ;flag_tranhol_emp equ	20h	;transmit holding register empty
  8274                                  ;flag_timeout	 equ	80h	;timeout
  8275                                  
  8276                                  ;	these flags reported in al:
  8277                                  
  8278                                  ;flag_cts	 equ	10h	;clear to send
  8279                                  ;flag_dsr	 equ	20h	;data set ready
  8280                                  ;flag_rec_sig	 equ	80h	;receive line signal detect
  8281                                  
  8282                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8283                                  
  8284                                  ;************************************************************************
  8285                                  ;*									*
  8286                                  ;*	aux_read - read cx bytes from [auxnum] aux port to buffer	*
  8287                                  ;*		   at es:di						*
  8288                                  ;*									*
  8289                                  ;************************************************************************
  8290                                  
  8291                                  aux_read:				; 2C7h:30Dh = 70h:287Dh
  8292                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2
  8293 00000306 E311                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8294 00000308 E87700                  		call	getbx		; put address of auxbuf	in bx
  8295 0000030B 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8296 0000030D 8607                    		xchg	al, [bx]
  8297 0000030F 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8298 00000311 7503                    		jnz	short aux2
  8299                                  aux1:					
  8300 00000313 E80500                  		call	auxin		; get character	from port
  8301                                  					; won't return if error
  8302                                  aux2:					
  8303 00000316 AA                      		stosb
  8304 00000317 E2FA                    		loop	aux1		; if more characters, go around	again
  8305                                  exvec2:					
  8306 00000319 F8                      		clc			; all done, successful exit
  8307                                  auxin_retn:	; 18/12/2022
  8308 0000031A C3                      		retn
  8309                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8310                                  
  8311                                  ;************************************************************************
  8312                                  ;*									*
  8313                                  ;*	auxin - call rom bios to read character from aux port		*
  8314                                  ;*		if error occurs, map the error and return one		*
  8315                                  ;*		level up to device driver exit code, setting		*
  8316                                  ;*		the number of bytes transferred appropriately		*
  8317                                  ;*									*
  8318                                  ;************************************************************************
  8319                                  
  8320                                  auxin:					
  8321 0000031B B402                    		mov	ah, 2		; auxfunc_receive
  8322 0000031D E83C00                  		call	auxop
  8323 00000320 F6C40E                  		test	ah, 0Eh		; flag_frame|flag_parity|flag_overrun
  8324                                  		;jnz	short arbad	; skip if any error bits set
  8325                                  		;retn
  8326                                  		; 25/06/2023 (BugFix)
  8327 00000323 74F5                    		jz	short auxin_retn
  8328                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8329                                  
  8330                                  arbad:					
  8331 00000325 58                      		pop	ax		; remove return	address	(near call)
  8332 00000326 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8333 00000328 0CB0                    		or	al, 0B0h	; flag_rec_sig|	flag_dsr|flag_cts
  8334 0000032A E9AAFD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
  8335                                  
  8336                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8337                                  
  8338                                  ;************************************************************************
  8339                                  ;*									*
  8340                                  ;*	aux_rdnd - non-destructive aux port read			*
  8341                                  ;*									*
  8342                                  ;************************************************************************
  8343                                  
  8344                                  aux_rdnd:				; 2C7h:335h = 70h:28A5h
  8345 0000032D E85200                  		call	getbx
  8346 00000330 8A07                    		mov	al, [bx]	; have bx point	to auxbuf
  8347 00000332 08C0                    		or	al, al		; if al	is non-zero (char in buffer)
  8348 00000334 7511                    		jnz	short auxdrx	; then return character
  8349 00000336 E82100                  		call	auxstat		; if not, get status of	aux device
  8350 00000339 F6C401                  		test	ah, 1		; flag_data_ready - test data ready
  8351 0000033C 740C                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8352 0000033E A820                    		test	al, 20h		; flag_dsr - test data set ready
  8353 00000340 7408                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8354 00000342 E8D6FF                  		call	auxin		; else aux is ready, get character
  8355 00000345 8807                    		mov	[bx], al
  8356                                  auxdrx:					
  8357 00000347 E9A7FE                  		jmp	rdexit		; return busy status
  8358                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8359                                  
  8360                                  auxbus:					
  8361 0000034A E979FE                  		jmp	z_bus_exit
  8362                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8363                                  
  8364                                  ;************************************************************************
  8365                                  ;*									*
  8366                                  ;*	aux_wrst - return aux port write status				*
  8367                                  ;*									*
  8368                                  ;************************************************************************
  8369                                  
  8370                                  aux_wrst:				; 2C7h:355h = 70h:28C5h
  8371 0000034D E80A00                  		call	auxstat		; get status of	aux in ax
  8372 00000350 A820                    		test	al, 20h		; test data set	ready
  8373 00000352 74F6                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8374 00000354 F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; flag_tranhol_emp - test transmit hold	reg empty
  8375 00000357 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8376                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8377                                  		; cf=0	; (test instruction resets cf)
  8378                                  		;clc
  8379 00000359 C3                      		retn
  8380                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8381                                  
  8382                                  ;************************************************************************
  8383                                  ;*									*
  8384                                  ;*	auxstat - call rom bios to determine aux port status		*
  8385                                  ;*									*
  8386                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
  8387                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8388                                  ;*									*
  8389                                  ;************************************************************************
  8390                                  
  8391                                  auxstat:				
  8392 0000035A B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
  8393                                  
  8394                                  		; fall into auxop
  8395                                  
  8396                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8397                                  
  8398                                  ;************************************************************************
  8399                                  ;*									*
  8400                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
  8401                                  ;*									*
  8402                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
  8403                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
  8404                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8405                                  ;*									*
  8406                                  ;************************************************************************
  8407                                  
  8408                                  auxop:		; proc near		
  8409 0000035C 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  8410                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  8411                                  					; get port number
  8412 00000360 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  8413                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  8414                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  8415 00000362 C3                      		retn
  8416                                  
  8417                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8418                                  
  8419                                  ;************************************************************************
  8420                                  ;*									*
  8421                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  8422                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  8423                                  ;*									*
  8424                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  8425                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  8426                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  8427                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  8428                                  ;*									*
  8429                                  ;************************************************************************
  8430                                  
  8431                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  8432 00000363 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  8433 00000366 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  8434                                  					; zero out buffer
  8435                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8436                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8437                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  8438 00000369 C3                      		retn
  8439                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8440                                  
  8441                                  ;************************************************************************
  8442                                  ;*									*
  8443                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  8444                                  ;*									*
  8445                                  ;************************************************************************
  8446                                  
  8447                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  8448                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  8449 0000036A E3AD                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8450                                  aux_loop:				
  8451 0000036C 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  8452                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  8453 0000036F 47                      		inc	di
  8454 00000370 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  8455 00000372 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  8456 00000375 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  8457 00000378 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  8458 0000037A B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  8459 0000037C E958FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  8460                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8461                                  
  8462                                  awok:					
  8463 0000037F E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  8464                                  					; still	more character to print
  8465                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8466                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8467                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  8468 00000381 C3                      		retn
  8469                                  
  8470                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8471                                  
  8472                                  ;************************************************************************
  8473                                  ;*									*
  8474                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  8475                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  8476                                  ;*									*
  8477                                  ;************************************************************************
  8478                                  
  8479                                  getbx:	
  8480 00000382 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  8481                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  8482                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  8483 00000386 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  8484                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8485                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  8486 0000038A C3                      		retn
  8487                                  
  8488                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8489                                  
  8490                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8491                                  
  8492                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8493                                  ;								:
  8494                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  8495                                  ;								:
  8496                                  ;								:
  8497                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  8498                                  ;								:
  8499                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  8500                                  ;								:
  8501                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  8502                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  8503                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  8504                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  8505                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  8506                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  8507                                  ;								:
  8508                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  8509                                  ;								:
  8510                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  8511                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  8512                                  ;								:
  8513                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8514                                  
  8515                                  ; convert time to ticks
  8516                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  8517                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  8518                                  
  8519                                  ;19/07/2019
  8520                                  ;09/03/2019
  8521                                  
  8522                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  8523                                  
  8524                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  8525                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  8526                                  
  8527 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  8528 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  8529 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  8530 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  8531 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  8532 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  8533 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  8534 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  8535 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  8536 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  8537 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  8538 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  8539 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  8540 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  8541 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  8542                                  
  8543                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  8544                                  
  8545 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  8546 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  8547 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  8548 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  8549 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  8550 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  8551 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  8552 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  8553 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  8554 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  8555 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  8556 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  8557 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  8558 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  8559 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  8560 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  8561 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  8562 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  8563 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  8564 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  8565                                  
  8566                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8567                                  
  8568                                  ; 17/10/2022
  8569                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8570                                  
  8571                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  8572                                  ;
  8573                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  8574                                  ;
  8575                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  8576                                  ;
  8577                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  8578                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  8579                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  8580                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  8581                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  8582                                  ;
  8583                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  8584                                  ;
  8585                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  8586                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  8587                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  8588                                  ;
  8589                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  8590                                  
  8591                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  8592 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  8593 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  8594                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  8595 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  8596                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  8597 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  8598 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  8599                                  					; get binary hours
  8600                                  					; convert to bcd
  8601 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  8602                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  8603 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  8604 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  8605 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  8606                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  8607 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  8608 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  8609 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  8610                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  8611 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  8612 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  8613 000003FB FA                      		cli
  8614 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  8615 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8616                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  8617                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  8618                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  8619 00000400 FB                      		sti
  8620                                  no_cmos_1:				
  8621 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  8622 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  8623                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8624 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  8625                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  8626                                  					; convert time to ticks
  8627                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  8628 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  8629 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8630 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  8631                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  8632                                  					; Return: time of day set
  8633                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  8634 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  8635 00000416 FB                      		sti
  8636                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  8637 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  8638 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  8639 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  8640                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  8641                                  					; convert to bcd format
  8642 00000422 FA                      		cli
  8643 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  8644 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  8645                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  8646                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  8647                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  8648 00000427 FB                      		sti
  8649                                  no_cmos_2:
  8650                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8651                                  		; cf=0				
  8652                                  		;clc
  8653 00000428 C3                      		retn
  8654                                  
  8655                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8656                                  
  8657                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8658                                  
  8659                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8660                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  8661                                  ; and returns the following information:
  8662                                  ;
  8663                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  8664                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  8665                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  8666                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  8667                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  8668                                  ;
  8669                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  8670                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  8671                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  8672                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8673                                  
  8674                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  8675 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  8676 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  8677                                  
  8678                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  8679                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  8680                                  ;
  8681                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  8682                                  ;	       ----------------
  8683                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  8684                                  ;
  8685                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  8686                                  ;
  8687                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  8688                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  8689                                  ;		1,193,180
  8690                                  ;
  8691                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  8692                                  ;
  8693                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  8694                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  8695                                  ;		59,659
  8696                                  ;
  8697                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  8698                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  8699                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  8700                                  ;
  8701                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  8702                                  ; multiply by 5
  8703                                  
  8704 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  8705 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  8706                                  					; multiply by 5
  8707 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  8708 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  8709 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  8710 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  8711 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  8712 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  8713 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  8714                                  
  8715                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  8716                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  8717                                  
  8718 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  8719 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  8720                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  8721 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  8722 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  8723 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  8724                                  
  8725                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  8726                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  8727                                  
  8728 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  8729 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  8730                                  
  8731                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  8732                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  8733                                  
  8734 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  8735 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  8736 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  8737 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  8738                                  noadj:					
  8739 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  8740 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  8741                                  
  8742                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  8743                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  8744                                  
  8745 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  8746 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  8747 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  8748 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  8749 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  8750 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  8751 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  8752 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  8753                                  
  8754                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  8755                                  
  8756 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  8757 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  8758 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  8759 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  8760 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  8761 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  8762 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  8763 00000478 F8                      		clc
  8764 00000479 C3                      		retn
  8765                                  
  8766                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8767                                  
  8768                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8769                                  
  8770                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8771                                  ;
  8772                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  8773                                  ;
  8774                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  8775                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  8776                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  8777                                  ;
  8778                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  8779                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  8780                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  8781                                  ;			else
  8782                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  8783                                  ;		}
  8784                                  ;
  8785                                  ; USES : AX
  8786                                  ;
  8787                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  8788                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  8789                                  ;
  8790                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8791                                  
  8792                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8793                                  GetTickCnt:	
  8794 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  8795 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  8796                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  8797                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  8798                                  					; midnight
  8799                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  8800 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  8801 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  8802 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  8803                                  					; and not flag
  8804 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  8805 0000048B C3                      		retn
  8806                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8807                                  
  8808                                  inc_case:				
  8809 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8810 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  8811 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  8812                                  no_rollover:				
  8813 00000494 C3                      		retn
  8814

  8819                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8820

  8822                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  8823                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
  8824                                  
  8825                                  ;error_unknown_media equ	7	; for use in BUILD BPB call
  8826                                  
  8827                                  ;struc BPB_TYPE
  8828                                  ;.SECSIZE:	resw 1
  8829                                  ;.SECALL:	resb 1
  8830                                  ;.RESNUM:	resw 1
  8831                                  ;.FATNUM:	resb 1
  8832                                  ;.DIRNUM:	resw 1
  8833                                  ;.SECNUM:	resw 1
  8834                                  ;.FATID:	resb 1
  8835                                  ;.FATSIZE:	resw 1
  8836                                  ;.SLIM:		resw 1
  8837                                  ;.HLIM:		resw 1
  8838                                  ;.HIDDEN:	resw 1
  8839                                  ;.size:
  8840                                  ;endstruc
  8841                                  
  8842                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  8843                                  ;	disk interface routines
  8844                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  8845                                  
  8846                                  ; device attribute bits:
  8847                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  8848                                  
  8849                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  8850                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  8851                                  
  8852                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  8853                                  
  8854                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  8855                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  8856                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  8857                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  8858                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  8859                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  8860                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  8861                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  8862                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  8863                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  8864                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  8865                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  8866                                  ; we reset the counter.
  8867                                  
  8868                                  accessmax	equ	5
  8869                                  
  8870                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  8871                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  8872                                  ;
  8873                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  8874                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  8875                                  ;	set slow = 15
  8876                                  ;   else
  8877                                  ;	set slow = value
  8878                                  ;   ...
  8879                                  ;*********************************************
  8880                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  8881                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  8882                                  ;*	 use slow
  8883                                  ;*   else
  8884                                  ;*	 use fast
  8885                                  ;*********************************************
  8886                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  8887                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  8888                                  ;	use slow
  8889                                  ;   else
  8890                                  ;	use fast
  8891                                  ;   ...
  8892                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  8893                                  ;
  8894                                  ;
  8895                                  ;---------------------------------------
  8896                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  8897                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  8898                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  8899                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  8900                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  8901                                  
  8902                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  8903                                  
  8904                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8905                                  
  8906                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  8907                                  
  8908                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  8909                                  ;	command jump table
  8910                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  8911                                  
  8912 00000495 00                      		db 0
  8913                                  
  8914                                  ; 11/12/2022
  8915                                  %if 0
  8916                                  
  8917                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  8918                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  8919                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init
  8920                                  		dw 4EBh			; media_chk
  8921                                  		dw 592h			; get_bpb
  8922                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  8923                                  		dw 857h			; dsk_read
  8924                                  		dw 83Dh			; x_bus_exit
  8925                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  8926                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  8927                                  		dw 849h			; dsk_writ
  8928                                  		dw 841h			; dsk_writv
  8929                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  8930                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  8931                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  8932                                  		dw 80Ah			; dsk_open
  8933                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close
  8934                                  		dw 831h			; dsk_rem
  8935                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  8936                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  8937                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  8982                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8983                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  8984                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  8985                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  8986                                  ;
  8987                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  8988                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8989                                  
  8990                                  SetDrive:	
  8991                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  8992 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  8993                                  X_Scan_Loop:

  8995 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  8996 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  8997 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh

  9007                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9008                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9009                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9010                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9011                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9012                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------

  9018                                  					; fchanged_by_format

  9020                                  		; 12/12/2022

  9027                                  					; fnon_removable

  9030 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done

  9035 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9036 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done

  9039                                  
  9040                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9041                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9042                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.

  9092                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9093                                  
  9094                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9095                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9096                                  ; drive.
  9097                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9098                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9099                                  ; returns in si:
  9100                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9101                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9102                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9103                                  ;
  9104                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9105                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9106                                  
  9107                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9108                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9109 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9110 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9111 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9112                                  					; get stored time
  9113 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9114 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9115 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9116 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9117 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9118 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9119 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9120 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9121                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9122 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9123 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9124 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9125                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9126                                  
  9127                                  timepassed:				
  9128 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9129                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9130 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9131                                  
  9132                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9133                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9134 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9135                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9136 00000582 C3                      		retn

  9266                                  
  9267                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9268                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9269                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9270                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9271                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9272                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9273                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9274                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9275                                  ;
  9276                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9277                                  ;
  9278                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9279                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9280                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9281                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9282                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9283                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9284                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9285                                  ;
  9286                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9287                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9288                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9289                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9290                                  
  9291                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9292                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9293 000005F7 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
  9294 000005FC 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
  9295 000005FE E99500                  		jmp	getret_exit
  9296                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9297                                  
  9298                                  getbp1:					
  9299 00000601 51                      		push	cx
  9300 00000602 52                      		push	dx
  9301 00000603 53                      		push	bx
  9302                                  
  9303                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
  9304                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
  9305                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
  9306                                  
  9307 00000604 E8A400                  		call	readbootsec
  9308 00000607 7209                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.
  9309 00000609 09DB                    		or	bx, bx		; bx is	0 if boot sector is valid.
  9310 0000060B 7508                    		jnz	short dofatbpb
  9311 0000060D E8F000                  		call	movbpb		; move bpb into	registers
  9312 00000610 EB57                    		jmp	short Has1
  9313                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9314                                  
  9315                                  getbp_err_ret_brdg:			
  9316 00000612 E98200                  		jmp	getbp_err_ret

  9318                                  
  9319                                  		; we have a 1.x diskette. In this case read in the fat ID byte
  9320                                  		; and fill in bpb from there.
  9321                                  dofatbpb:				
  9322 00000615 E85401                  		call	readfat		; puts media descriptor	byte in	ah
  9323 00000618 72F8                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg
  9324                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	;  changeline support available?
  9325 0000061A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; 19/10/2022
  9326 0000061F 7403                    		jz	short bpb_nochangeline ; brif not
  9327 00000621 E88D12                  		call	hidensity	; may not return! May add sp, 2	and
  9328                                  					; jump to has1!!!!!! or	has720K
  9329                                  bpb_nochangeline:		; test for a valid 3.5" medium

  9331                                  					; ffSmall
  9332 00000629 7515                    		jnz	short is_floppy
  9333 0000062B 80FCF9                  		cmp	ah, 0F9h	; is it	a valid	fat id byte for	3.5" ?
  9334 0000062E 7571                    		jnz	short got_unknown_medium
  9335                                  Has720K:				
  9336                                  		;mov	bx, offset sm92 ; pointer to correct bpb
  9337 00000630 BB[DE04]                		mov	bx, sm92	; 19/10/2022
  9338

  9431                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9432                                  
  9433                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9434                                  
  9435                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9436                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9437                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9438                                  ;
  9439                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9440                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9441                                  
  9442                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9443                                  
  9444                                  readbootsec:	
  9445 000006AB B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9446 000006AD B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9447 000006B0 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9448 000006B3 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9449 000006B5 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9450                                  
  9451                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9452                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9453                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9454                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9455                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9456                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9457                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9458                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9459                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9460                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9461                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9462                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9463                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9464                                  		; informations
  9465                                  
  9466                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9467                                  
  9468                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9469 000006B7 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9470 000006BC 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9471 000006BE 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9472 000006C3 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9473 000006C5 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9474 000006CA 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9475 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9476 000006D1 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9477                                  
  9478                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9479                                  ;
  9480                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9481                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9482                                  ;;
  9483                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9484                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9485                                  ;;
  9486                                  ;;check_signature:
  9487                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9488                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9489                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9490                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9491                                  
  9492                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9493                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9494                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9495                                  
  9496                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9497                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9498 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9499                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9500 000006D6 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9501 000006D8 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9502 000006DA 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9503                                  
  9504                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9505                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9506                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9507                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9508                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9509                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9510                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9511                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9512                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9513                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9514                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9515                                  
  9516                                  checksinglesided:
  9517 000006DC A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9518 000006DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9519 000006E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9520 000006E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9521 000006E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9522 000006E7 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9523 000006ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9524 000006EF 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9525 000006F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9526                                  
  9527                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9528                                  
  9529                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9530 000006F6 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9531                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9532 000006FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9533                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9534                                  
  9535                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9536 000006FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9537                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9538                                  movbpb_ret:
  9539                                  gooddsk:				
  9540 000006FE F8                      		clc
  9541                                  err_ret:
  9542 000006FF C3                      		retn
  9543                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9544                                  
  9545                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9546                                  ;err_ret:				
  9547                                  		;retn

  9549                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9550                                  
  9551                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9552                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9553                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
  9554                                  ; getbp routine at has1
  9555                                  ;
  9556                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
  9557                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
  9558                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
  9559                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
  9560                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
  9561                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
  9562                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9563                                  
  9564                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9565                                  
  9566                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9567                                  movbpb:	
  9568 00000700 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
  9569                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9570                                  					; sectors per unit
  9571 00000704 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
  9572                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  9573                                  					; number of directory entries
  9574 00000708 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
  9575                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  9576                                  					; size of drive
  9577 0000070C 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
  9578                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9579                                  					; media	descriptor
  9580 00000710 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
  9581                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  9582                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9583 00000713 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
  9584                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
  9585                                  					; sectors per track
  9586 00000717 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
  9587                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
  9588                                  					; number of heads
  9589 0000071B 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
  9590 00000720 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9591 00000722 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
  9592 00000725 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
  9593 00000727 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
  9594                                  movbpb_conv:				
  9595 0000072C 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
  9596 00000731 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9597 00000733 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
  9598                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9599                                  		; cf = 0
  9600                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
  9601                                  		;clc
  9602 00000736 C3                      		retn
  9603                                  
  9604                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9605                                  
  9606                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
  9607                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
  9608                                  ;by es:di.
  9609                                  
  9610                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
  9611                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
  9612                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
  9613                                  ;      the boot record information.
  9614                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
  9615                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
  9616                                  
  9617                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9618                                  mov_media_ids:		
  9619 00000737 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
  9620                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
  9621                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
  9622 0000073C 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
  9623 0000073E 51                      		push	cx
  9624 0000073F 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
  9625                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
  9626 00000743 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9627 00000747 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
  9628                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
  9629 0000074B 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
  9630 0000074F 57                      		push	di
  9631 00000750 56                      		push	si
  9632 00000751 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9633 00000754 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
  9634                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
  9635                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
  9636 00000757 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
  9637 0000075A F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9638                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
  9639                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9640 0000075C B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
  9641 0000075E BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
  9642                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
  9643 00000761 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9644 00000764 F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9645 00000766 5E                      		pop	si
  9646 00000767 5F                      		pop	di

  9648                                  		; 10/12/2022
