 14928                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14929                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 14930                                  
 14931                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 14932                                  
 14933                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 14934                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 14935                                  ;
 14936                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 14937                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 14938                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 14939                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 14940                                  ;
 14941                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 14942                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 14943                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 14944                                  
 14945                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 14946                                  
 14947                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14948                                  
 14949                                  struc	DPB
 14950 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 14951 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 14952 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 14953 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 14954 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 14955 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 14956 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 14957 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 14958 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 14959 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 14960                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 14961 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 14962 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 14963 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 14964 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 14965 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 14966                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 14967 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 14968 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 14969 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 14970                                  .size:
 14971                                  endstruc
 14972                                  
 14973                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 14974                                  
 14975                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 15032                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15033                                  
 15034                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15035                                  ;
 15036                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15037                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15038                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15039                                  ;
 15040                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15041                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15042                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15043                                  ;
 15044                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15045                                  
 15046                                  struc A_BPB
 15047 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15048 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15049 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15050 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15051 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15052 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15053 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15054 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15055 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15056 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15057 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15058 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15059 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15060 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15061 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15062                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15063                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15064                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15065                                  .size:
 15066                                  endstruc
 15067                                  
 15068                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 15069 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 15070 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15071 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15072 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15073 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15074 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15075 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15076 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 15077                                  endstruc

 15107                                  ; Memory arena structure

 15110                                  ; (MSDOS 6.0, ARENA.INC)
 15111                                  
 15112                                  ;** Arena Header

 15325                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15326                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15327                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15328                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15329                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15330                                  									  
 15331                                  ;*******************************					  
 15332                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15333                                  ;*******************************					  
 15334                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15335                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15336                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15337                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15338                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15339                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15340                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15341                                  ;For all others:							  
 15342                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15343                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15344                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15345                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15346                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15347                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15348                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15349                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15350                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15351                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15352                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15353                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15354                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15355                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15356                                  ;									  
 15357                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15358                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15359                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15360                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15361                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15362                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15363                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15364                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15365                                  ;									  
 15366                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15367                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15368                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15369                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15370                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15371                                  ;									  
 15372                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15373                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15374                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15375                                  ;									  
 15376                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15377                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15378                                  ;									  
 15379                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15380                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15381                                  ;									  
 15382                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15383                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15384                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15385                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15386                                  ;						called. 		  
 15387                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15388                                  ;									  
 15389                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15390                                  ;									  
 15391                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15392                                  ;									  
 15393                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15394                                  ;									  
 15395                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15396                                  ;									  
 15397                                  
 15398                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15399                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15400 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1

 15404 00000004 ??                      			resb 1

 15407                                  endstruc

 15516                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15517                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15518                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15519                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15520                                  
 15521                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15522                                  ;
 15523                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15524                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15525                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15526                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15527                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15528                                  ;
 15529                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15530                                  ;
 15531                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15532                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15533                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15534                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15535                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15536                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15537                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15538                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15539                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15540                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 15541                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 15542                                  
 15543                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 15544                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 15545                                  
 15546                                  struc 		curdir_list
 15547                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15548 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 15549 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 15550 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 15551 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 15552 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 15553 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 15554                                  ; MSDOS 6.0

 15582                                  
 15583                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 15584                                  ;
 15585                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 15586                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 15587                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 15588                                  
 15589                                  struc	SF
 15590 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 15591 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 15592 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 15593                                  .size:
 15594                                  endstruc
 15595                                  
 15596                                  ;**	System file table entry
 15597                                  ;
 15598                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 15599                                  
 15600                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 15601 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 15602                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 15603 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 15604 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 15605 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 15606                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 15607                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 15608                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 15609                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 15610                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 15611                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 15612                                  					;   (WRITE)
 15613                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 15614                                  					;
 15615                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 15616                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 15617                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 15618                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 15619                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 15620                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 15621                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15622                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15623                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15624                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15625                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 15626                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15627 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 15628                                  					; to device header if local device,
 15629                                  					; points to net device header if
 15630                                  					; remote
 15631 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 15632                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 15633 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 15634 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 15635 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 15636 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 15637                                  ;
 15638                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 15639                                  ; ID
 15640                                  ;
 15641 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 15642 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 15643 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above

 15646                                  ;

 15930                                  SYSINIT$:
 15931                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 15932                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 15938                                  ; 05/07/2018
 15939                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15940                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 15941                                  
 15942                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15943                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 15944                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15945                                  
 15946                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 15947                                  ;
 15948                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 15949                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 15950                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 15951                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 15952                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 15953                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 15954                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 15955                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 15956                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 15957                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 15958                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 15959                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 15960                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 15961                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 15962                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 15963                                  ;
 15964                                  
 15965                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 15966                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 15967                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 15968                                  ;
 15969                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 15970                                  ;
 15971                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 15972                                  ;
 15973                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 15974                                  ;
 15975                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 15976                                  ;
 15977                                  
 15978                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 15979                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 15980                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 15981                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 15982                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 15983                                  ;      deeply nested one
 15984                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 15985                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 15986                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 15987                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 15988                                  
 15989                                  		;EVEN
 15990                                  ;align 2
 15991                                  		; 21/10/2022
 15992                                  
 15993 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 15994 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 15995 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 15996 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 15997 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 15998 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 15999                                  
 16000 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16001 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16002 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16003                                  
 16004                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16005                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16006                                  
 16007                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16008                                  
 16009 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16010                                  
 16011                                  int02:
 16012                                  
 16013                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16014                                  ;
 16015                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16016                                  ;
 16017                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16018                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16019                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16020                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16021                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16022                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16023                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16024                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16025                                  ;
 16026                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16027                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16028                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16029                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16030                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16031                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16032                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16033                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16034                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16035                                  ;
 16036                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16037                                  
 16038 00000016 50                      	push	ax

 16288                                  ;********************************************************************
 16289                                  ;common routines
 16290                                  ;********************************************************************
 16291                                  
 16292                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16293                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16294                                  ; service routine
 16295                                  
 16296                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16297                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16298                                  
 16299                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16300                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16301                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16302                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16303                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16304                                  
 16305                                  do_int_stacks:
 16306 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16307 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16308 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16309 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16310 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16311 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16312                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16313                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16314                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16315 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16316 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16317 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16318                                  
 16319 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16320                                  
 16321                                  found02:
 16322 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16323 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16324                                  
 16325 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16326                                  
 16327 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16328                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16329                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16330                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16331                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16332 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16333 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16334                                  
 16335                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16336                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16337                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16338                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16339                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16340                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16341                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16342                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16343                                  
 16344                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16345 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16346 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16347 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16348 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16349 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16350 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16351 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16352 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16353                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16354                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16355 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16356                                  
 16357 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16358                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16359 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16360                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16361                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16362                                  
 16363 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16364                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16365 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16366                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16367                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16368 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16369 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16370                                  
 16371                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16372                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16373                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16374 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16375 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16376                                  
 16377 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16378 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16379 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16380 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16381 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16382                                  
 16383                                  notfree02:
 16384 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16385 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16386                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16387                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16388                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16389 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16390                                  
 16391                                  findnext02:
 16392 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16393 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16394                                  
 16395                                  foundbad02:
 16396 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16397 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16398 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16399                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16400                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16401                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16402 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16403 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16404                                  
 16405                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16406                                  
 16407                                  ; Common routines
 16408                                  
 16409                                  longpath:
 16410                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16411 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16412                                  lploopp:
 16413                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16414                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16415                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16416 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16417 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16418                                  
 16419 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16420                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16421                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16422                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16423 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16424 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16425 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16426                                  
 16427 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16428 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16429                                  
 16430                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16431                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16432                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16433 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16434                                  inuse:
 16435 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16436 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16437 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16438 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16439                                  found:
 16440 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16441                                  fatal:
 16442 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 16443 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 16444 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16445 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 16446 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 16447 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16448                                  
 16449 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 16450 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16451                                  
 16452                                  skip_nmis:
 16453 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 16454 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 16455 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 16456 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 16457                                  
 16458 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 16459 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 16460 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 16461                                  ;SR;
 16462                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 16463                                  ;
 16464 00000215 50                      	push	ax
 16465 00000216 1E                      	push	ds
 16466                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 16467                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 16468                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16469 00000217 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 16470 0000021A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16471                                  
 16472                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 16473 0000021C F606[CE08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 16474 00000221 1F                      	pop	ds
 16475 00000222 58                      	pop	ax
 16476 00000223 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 16477                                  
 16478                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 16479                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 16480                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16481 00000225 9A[CF08]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 16482                                  ;
 16483                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 16484                                  ;
 16485                                  fatal_loop:
 16486 0000022A AC                      	lodsb
 16487 0000022B 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 16488 0000022D 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 16489                                  
 16490 0000022F B307                    	mov	bl,7
 16491 00000231 B40E                    	mov	ah,14
 16492 00000233 CD10                    	int	10h			; whoops, this enables ints
 16493 00000235 EBF3                    	jmp	short fatal_loop
 16494                                  
 16495                                  fatal_done:
 16496 00000237 EBFE                    	jmp	short fatal_done

 17644                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 17645                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 17646                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 17647                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 17648                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 17649                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 17650                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 17651                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 17652                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 17653                                  ;
 17654                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 17655                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 17656                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 17657                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 17658                                  ; been patched.

 17935 000007D9 880E[A902]              	mov     [command_line],cl ; command line length (except CR)
 17936                                  
 17937                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17938                                  
 17939                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 17940                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 17941                                  ;   which follow....)
 17942                                  
 17943                                  retry:
 17944 000007DD BA[1D34]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 17945                                  
 17946                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 17947                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 17948                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 17949                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 17950                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 17951                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 17952                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 17953                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 17954                                  
 17955                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 17956                                  
 17957 000007E0 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 17958 000007E1 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 17959 000007E4 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 17960 000007E6 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 17961 000007E8 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 17962 000007EA CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 17963 000007EC 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 17964                                  
 17965 000007EE 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17966 000007F0 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 17967 000007F2 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 17968 000007F4 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 17969                                  
 17970                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 17971                                  
 17972                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 17973                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 17974                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 17975                                  
 17976                                  	; 22/10/2022
 17977                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 17978 000007F6 8B1E[9202]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 17979 000007FA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 17980                                  
 17981                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 17982                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 17983                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 17984                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 17985                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 17986                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 17987                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 17988                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 17989                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 17990                                  ;
 17991                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 17992                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 17993                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 17994                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 17995                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 17996                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 17997                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 17998                                  
 17999                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18000                                  	;mov	cx,[config_envlen]
 18001                                          ;jcxz	no_env		; use config_wrkseg only if there's env data
 18002                                          ;mov	ax,[config_wrkseg]

 18009 00000803 722C                    	jc	short memerrjx	; if there isn't even this much memory, give up
 18010

 18344                                  ;

 18759                                  
 18760                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 18761                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 18762                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 18763                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 18764                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 18765                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 18766                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 18767                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 18768                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 18769                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 18770                                  ;	  stub will go.
 18771                                  ;
 18772                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 18773                                  
 18774                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18775                                  update_arena:
 18776 00000986 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 18777 00000987 57                      	push	di
 18778 00000988 51                      	push	cx
 18779 00000989 52                      	push	dx
 18780                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18781                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 18782                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18783                                  	; ds = cs 
 18784 0000098A C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 18785 0000098E 4F                      	dec	di
 18786 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 18787                                  						;  before sysvar
 18788 00000990 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 18789                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 18790 00000992 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 18791 00000997 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 18792 00000999 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 18793                                  
 18794                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 18795 0000099B 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 18796 000009A0 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 18797 000009A2 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 18798 000009A4 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 18799 000009A6 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18800                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 18801 000009A8 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 18802                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 18803 000009AC C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 18804 000009B2 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 18805                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 18806 000009B4 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 18807 000009B8 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 18808                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18809                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 18810 000009BA 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 18811 000009BD 5A                      	pop	dx
 18812 000009BE 59                      	pop	cx
 18813 000009BF 5F                      	pop	di
 18814 000009C0 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 18815 000009C1 C3                      	retn
 18816                                  ;
 18817                                  ; M012 : END
 18818                                  ;

 18835                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18836                                  ;
 18837                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 18838                                  ;
 18839                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 18840                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 18841                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 18842                                  ;
 18843                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 18844                                  ;
 18845                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18846                                  
 18847                                  AllocHMA:
 18848                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 18849                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 18850                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 18851                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 18852                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 18853                                  
 18854                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 18855                                  ;
 18856                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 18857                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 18858                                  ;	push	ax
 18859                                  ;	popf
 18860                                  ;	pushf
 18861                                  ;	pop	ax
 18862                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 18863                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 18864                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 18865                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 18866                                  
 18867                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18868                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 18869                                  
 18870 000009CD 1E                      	push	ds
 18871                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 18872                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 18873                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18874 000009CE B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 18875 000009D1 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18876                                  
 18877 000009D3 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 18878 000009D6 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 18879                                  
 18880 000009D8 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 18881 000009DB CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 18882                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 18883                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 18884                                  
 18885 000009DD 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 18886                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 18887 000009E1 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 18888                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 18889                                  
 18890 000009E5 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 18891 000009E7 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 18892                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 18893 000009EA FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 18894 000009EE 48                      	dec	ax
 18895 000009EF 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 18896                                  
 18897                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 18898                                  
 18899 000009F1 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 18900 000009F3 CD15                    	int	15h
 18901                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 18902                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 18903                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 18904 000009F5 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 18905                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 18906                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18907 000009F8 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 18908                                  allocHMA_1:
 18909 000009FA B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 18910                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 18911 000009FC FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 18912 00000A00 48                      	dec	ax
 18913 00000A01 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 18914                                  
 18915 00000A03 E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 18916 00000A06 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 18917                                  
 18918 00000A08 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 18919 00000A0B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18920 00000A0D 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 18921 00000A14 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 18922                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 18923                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18924 00000A1B 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 18925                                  
 18926                                  ; 11/12/2022
 18927                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 18928                                  ;	; cf=0
 18929                                  ;	;clc
 18930                                  ;	pop	ds
 18931                                  ;	retn
 18932

 19005                                  
 19006                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19007                                  ;
 19008                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19009                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19010                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19011                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19012                                  ;
 19013                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19014                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19015                                  ;
 19016                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19017                                  
 19018                                  StartVDHead:
 19019                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19020                                  
 19021 00000A45 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19022 00000A49 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19023 00000A4B 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19024 00000A4D 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19025 00000A4F 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19026                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19027 00000A50 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19028                                  VDiskSig1:
 19029 00000A57 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19030                                  
 19031                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19032                                  
 19033 00000A5C 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19034                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19035 00000A62 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19036 00000A71 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19037 00000A73 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19038                                  VDInt19:
 19039 00000A74 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19040                                  OldVDInt19:
 19041 00000A75 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19042                                  
 19043                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19044                                  
 19045                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19046 00000A79 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19047                                  VDiskSig2:
 19048 00000A7C 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19049                                  
 19050                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19051                                  
 19052 00000A81 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19053 00000A84 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19054 00000A86 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19055 00000A87 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19056 00000A89 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19057 00000A8A 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19058 00000A8C 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19059 00000A8E FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19060 00000A8F 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19061 00000A91 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19062 00000A93 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19063 00000A95 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19064 00000A97 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19065                                  
 19066                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19067                                  
 19068                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19069                                  ;
 19070                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19071                                  ;
 19072                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19073                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19074                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19075                                  ;
 19076                                  ; Inputs : None
 19077                                  ;
 19078                                  ; Outputs : None
 19079                                  ;
 19080                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19081                                  ;
 19082                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19083                                  
 19084                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19085                                  
 19086                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19087 00000A99 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19088 00000A9B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19089                                  
 19090                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19091                                  
 19092                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19093 00000A9D A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19094                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19095 00000AA0 2EA3[750A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19096 00000AA4 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19097                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19098 00000AA7 2EA3[770A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19099                                  
 19100                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19101                                  
 19102 00000AAB B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19103                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19104                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19105 00000AAD BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19106 00000AB0 CD21                    	int	21h
 19107                                  
 19108                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19109                                  
 19110 00000AB2 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19111 00000AB3 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19112                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19113 00000AB5 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19114                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19115 00000ABC 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19116 00000AC3 40                      	inc	ax
 19117 00000AC4 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19118                                  
 19119                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19120                                  
 19121 00000AC6 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19122                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19123 00000AC7 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19124 00000ACD A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19125                                  
 19126                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 19127                                  
 19128                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 19129 00000AD0 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 19130 00000AD3 BE[450A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 19131 00000AD6 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19132 00000AD8 0E                      	push	cs
 19133 00000AD9 1F                      	pop	ds
 19134 00000ADA FC                      	cld
 19135 00000ADB F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19136 00000ADD FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 19137                                  
 19138                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 19139                                  
 19140                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19141 00000ADE 57                      	push	di
 19142 00000ADF 06                      	push	es
 19143                                  
 19144 00000AE0 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19145 00000AE3 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19146 00000AE5 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 19147                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 19148 00000AE8 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 19149 00000AEB BE[790A]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 19150 00000AEE F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 19151                                  
 19152 00000AF0 5F                      	pop	di
 19153 00000AF1 07                      	pop	es
 19154                                  
 19155 00000AF2 C3                      	retn

 19157                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19158                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 19159                                  ;
 19160                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 19161                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 19162                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 19163                                  ;
 19164                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19165                                  
 19166                                  struc desc
 19167 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 19168 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 19169 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 19170 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 19171 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 19172                                   .size:

 19174                                  
 19175                                  		; 23/10/2022
 19176                                  bmove:		;label byte
 19177

 19179 00000AF3 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0		 
 19180                                  gdt:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 19181 00000AFB 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 19182 00000B03 FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 19183 00000B05 0000                    		dw	0
 19184 00000B07 00                      		db	0
 19185 00000B08 93                      		db	93h
 19186 00000B09 0000                    		dw	0
 19187 00000B0B FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB
 19188 00000B0D 0000                    		dw	0
 19189 00000B0F 10                      		db	10h
 19190 00000B10 93                      		db	93h

 19196 00000B1B 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 19197                                  
 19198 00000B23 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 19199                                  
 19200                                  
 19201                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIt1.ASM)
 19202                                  
 19203                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19204                                  
 19205                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19206                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19207                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19208                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19209                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19210                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19211                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19212                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19213                                  ;								      ;I070
 19214                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19215                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19216                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19217                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19218                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19219                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19220                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19221                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19222                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19223                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19224                                  ;								      ;I070
 19225                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19226                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19227                                  
 19228                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19229                                  	; ds = cs
 19230                                  
 19231 00000B43 06                      	push	es
 19232 00000B44 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 19233 00000B46 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 19234 00000B48 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 19235 00000B4A D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 19236 00000B4C B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19237 00000B4E D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19238 00000B50 05[230B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 19239 00000B53 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 19240                                  
 19241                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 19242                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 19243                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax

 19264                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19265                                  ;
 19266                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19267                                  ;
 19268                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19269                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19270                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19271                                  ;		the offset.
 19272                                  ;
 19273                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 19274                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 19275                                  ;
 19276                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19277                                  
 19278                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 19279 00000B6B 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 19280 00000B6D B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 19281 00000B70 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19282 00000B72 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19283 00000B75 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19284 00000B78 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19285 00000B7A D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19286 00000B7C 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19287 00000B7E 1E                      	push	ds
 19288                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 19289                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 19290                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19291 00000B7F B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 19292 00000B82 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19293 00000B84 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19294 00000B88 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 19295 00000B8D 1F                      	pop	ds
 19296 00000B8E C3                      	retn

 19400                                  ;	BUGBUG - we don't update confbot - won't someone else use it?
 19401                                  ;	chuckst -- answer: no. Confbot is used to access the CDSs,
 19402                                  ;	25 jul 92  which are stored BELOW it. Alloclim is the
 19403                                  ;		   variable which has the top of free memory for
 19404                                  ;		   device driver loads, etc.
 19405

 19407                                  
 19408                                  ;	chuckst, 25 Jul 92 -- note: I'm removing the code here
 19409                                  ;		that automatically updates alloclim every time we
 19410                                  ;		set up some new CDSs. Instead, I've added code
 19411                                  ;		which pre-allocates space for 26 CDSs. This
 19412                                  ;	        way we've got room for worst case CDSs before
 19413                                  ;		we place MagicDrv.sys

 19418                                  	; (SYSINIT:0C52h)

 19420
