 20223                                  
 20224                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20225                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20226                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20227                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20228                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20229                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20230                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20231                                  ;
 20232                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20233                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20234                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20235                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20236                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20237                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20238                                  ;
 20239                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20240                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20241                                  ;
 20242                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20243                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20244                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20245                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20246                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20247                                  ;
 20248                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20249                                  ;
 20250                                  ;			  none.
 20251                                  
 20252                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20253                                  ;
 20254                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20255                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20256                                  
 20257                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20258                                  
 20259 00000F58 50                      	push	ax

 20261 00000F5A 52                      	push	dx

 20264 00000F5C B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port

 20461                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20462                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20463                                  ;
 20464                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20465                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20466                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20467                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20468                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20469                                  ; program).

 20474

 20476                                  
 20477                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20478                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20479                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20480                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20481                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20482                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20483                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20484                                  ; carridge return.

 20607                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20608                                  
 20609                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20610                                  ;
 20611                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20612                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20613                                  ;
 20614                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20615                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 20616                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 20617                                  
 20618                                  ParaRound:
 20619 000010C0 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20620 000010C3 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 20621 000010C5 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20622 000010C7 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20623 000010C9 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20624 000010CB C3                      	retn
 20625                                  
 20626                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20627                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 20628                                  ;
 20629                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 20630                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 20631                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 20632                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 20633                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 20634                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 20635                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 20636                                  ;
 20637                                  ;in: after relocation,
 20638                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 20639                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 20640                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 20641                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 20642                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 20643                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 20644                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 20645                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 20646                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 20647                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 20648                                  ;
 20649                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 20650                                  
 20651                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20652                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20653                                  sysinit_base:				
 20654 000010CC 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 20655 000010D1 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 20656 000010D6 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 20657 000010D8 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 20658 000010DD 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 20659 000010E2 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 20660 000010E3 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 20661 000010E4 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 20662                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 20663                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 20664 000010E6 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 20665 000010E9 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 20666 000010EE 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 20667                                  
 20668                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 20669                                  
 20670 000010F0 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20671 000010F2 0E                      	push	cs
 20672 000010F3 1F                      	pop	ds
 20673 000010F4 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20674 000010F7 CD21                    	int	21h
 20675                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20676                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20677                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20678                                  _stall: 
 20679                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20680 000010F9 F4                      	hlt 
 20681                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20682                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 20683 000010FA EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 20684                                  
 20685                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 20686 000010FC 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 20687                                  
 20688                                  ;-------------------------------------
 20689                                  
 20690                                  sum_up:
 20691                                  
 20692                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 20693                                  ;out:  ax - result
 20694                                  ;
 20695                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 20696                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 20697                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 20698                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 20699                                  ;
 20700                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 20701                                  
 20702 00001101 1E                      	push	ds
 20703                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 20704                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20705 00001102 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 20706 00001106 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20707 00001108 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 20708 0000110A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20709 0000110C 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 20710                                  					;whole test better fail.
 20711 00001111 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 20712 00001113 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 20713                                  sum1:
 20714 00001115 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 20715 00001117 46                      	inc	si
 20716 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 20717 00001119 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 20718                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 20719                                  sum_sys_code:
 20720                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20721 0000111B BE1A11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20722                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 20723                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 20724                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 20725                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20726                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 20727                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 20728                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 20729 0000111E B9[B038]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 20730 00001121 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 20731 00001123 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 20732                                  sum2:

 20761                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20762                                  ; Set_Buffer
 20763                                  ;
 20764                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 20765                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 20766                                  ;
 20767                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 20768                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 20769                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 20770                                  ;
 20771                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 20772                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 20773                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20774                                  
 20775                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20776                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 20777                                  
 20778                                  set_buffer:
 20779 0000114D 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 20780 0000114F E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 20781 00001152 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 20782 00001154 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 20783                                  set_buff_1:
 20784                                  	; 25/10/2022
 20785                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 20786 00001156 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 20787                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 20788 00001158 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 20789                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 20790 0000115B C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 20791                                  
 20792 00001160 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 20793 00001162 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 20794 00001167 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 20795                                  
 20796                                  ;	for each buffer
 20797                                  
 20798                                  nxt_buff:
 20799 00001168 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 20800 0000116B 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 20801 0000116D E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 20802                                  
 20803 0000116F 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 20804                                  
 20805 00001174 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 20806                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 20807 00001175 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 20808 00001178 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 20809                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 20810                                  	; 25/10/2022
 20811 0000117A 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 20812                                  
 20813 0000117E 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 20814 00001180 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 20815                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 20816 00001182 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 20817 00001186 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 20818                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 20819 0000118A C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 20820                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 20821 0000118F 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 20822 00001192 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 20823                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 20824 00001196 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 20825                                  set_buff_2:
 20826 00001199 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 20827                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 20828 0000119E 2E800E[3414]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 20829                                  	;call	round
 20830                                  	;retn
 20831                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20832 000011A4 E9E11E                  	jmp	round

 20834                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20835                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 20836                                  ;
 20837                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 20838                                  ;
 20839                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 20840                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 20841                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20842                                  
 20843                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 20844                                  GetBufferAddr:
 20845 000011A7 53                      	push	bx
 20846 000011A8 52                      	push	dx
 20847 000011A9 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 20848 000011AD 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 20849                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 20850 000011B2 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 20851                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20852                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 20853                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20854 000011B5 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 20855 000011B7 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 20856 000011B9 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 20857                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 20858 000011BC CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 20859 000011BE 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 20860 000011C1 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 20861 000011C3 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 20862                                  	;zf=1
 20863                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 20864                                  	;zf=1
 20865 000011C6 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 20866                                  got_hma:
 20867 000011CB 5A                      	pop	dx
 20868 000011CC 5B                      	pop	bx
 20869 000011CD C3                      	retn

 20880                                  ;out:
 20881                                  ;    above entries set.

 20886 000011D3 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 20887 000011D7 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 20888 000011DB 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 20889                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 20890 000011E0 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax

 20892 000011E3 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh

 20894 000011E9 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 20895                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 20896 000011EF 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 20897 000011F5 C3                      	retn

 20899                                  ; ======================================================================
 20900                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 20901                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20902                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20903                                  
 20904                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20905                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 20906                                  ;
 20907                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 20908                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 20909                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 20910                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 20911                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 20912                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 20913                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 20914                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 20915                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 20916                                  ;
 20917                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 20918                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 20919                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 20920                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 20921                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 20922                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 20923                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 20924                                  ;	conditions:
 20925                                  ;
 20926                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 20927                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 20928                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 20929                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 20930                                  ;
 20931                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 20932                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 20933                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 20934                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 20935                                  ;
 20936                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 20937                                  ;
 20938                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 20939                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 20940                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 20941                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 20942                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 20943                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 20944                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 20945                                  ;	interrupt line.
 20946                                  ;
 20947                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 20948                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 20949                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 20950                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 20951                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 20952                                  ;
 20953                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 20954                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 20955                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 20956                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 20957                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 20958                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 20959                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 20960                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 20961                                  ;
 20962                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 20963                                  
 20964                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20965                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 20966                                  
 20967                                  	; 14/12/2022
 20968                                  stackinit:
 20969 000011F6 50                      	push	ax
 20970 000011F7 1E                      	push	ds
 20971 000011F8 06                      	push	es
 20972 000011F9 53                      	push	bx
 20973 000011FA 51                      	push	cx
 20974 000011FB 52                      	push	dx
 20975 000011FC 57                      	push	di
 20976 000011FD 56                      	push	si
 20977 000011FE 55                      	push	bp
 20978                                  
 20979                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 20980                                  
 20981                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20982                                  	; ds = cs
 20983 000011FF A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 20984 00001202 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 20985                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20986                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 20987                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 20988 00001204 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 20989                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 20990 00001208 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 20991 0000120B 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 20992                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20993 0000120F A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 20994                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20995                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 20996                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 20997 00001212 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 20998                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20999 00001216 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21000 00001218 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]

 21002                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21003                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21004 0000121B 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21005                                  
 21006                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21007

 21009

 21011                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21016

 21022 00001229 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21023 0000122B 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax

 21027                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21028                                  
 21029 00001234 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]

 21031 0000123D F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21032 0000123F 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21033 00001241 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21034 00001243 06                      	push	es
 21035 00001244 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21036                                  
 21037                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21038                                  
 21039 00001245 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21040 00001249 FC                      	cld
 21041 0000124A F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21042                                  
 21043 0000124C 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21044                                  
 21045                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21046                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21047                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21048                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21049                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 21050                                  
 21051                                  buildloop:

 21779 000013D4 7411                    	je	short int_xx_not_first
 21780                                  	
 21781 000013D6 81FA00F0                	cmp	dx,0F000h
 21782 000013DA 750B                    	jne	short int_xx_not_first
 21783                                  
 21784 000013DC 06                      	push	es
 21785                                  	;push	dx
 21786                                  	;mov	dx,0F000h
 21787 000013DD 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 21788 000013DF 263B1E01FF              	cmp	bx,[es:0FF01h]
 21789                                        	;pop	dx
 21790 000013E4 07                      	pop	es
 21791 000013E5 7401                    	je	short int_xx_first
 21792                                  
 21793                                  int_xx_not_first:
 21794 000013E7 F9                      	stc
 21795                                  int_xx_first:
 21796 000013E8 1F                      	pop	ds
 21797 000013E9 C3                      	retn
 21798                                  
 21799                                  ;%endif
 21800                                  
 21801                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21802                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21803                                  
 21804                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21805                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 21806                                  
 21807                                  new_init_loop:
 21808                                  
 21809                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 21810                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 21811                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 21812                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 21813                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 21814                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 21815                                  
 21816 000013EA 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 21817 000013ED 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 21818 000013EF 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 21819 000013F3 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 21820                                  
 21821 000013F6 1E                      	push	ds
 21822                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 21823                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 21824                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21825 000013F7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 21826 000013FA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 21827 000013FC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 21828 000013FF 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 21829 00001401 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 21830 00001405 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 21831 00001408 1F                      	pop	ds
 21832                                  
 21833 00001409 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 21834 0000140C 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 21835 00001410 C3                      	retn
 21836                                  
 21837                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 21838                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21839                                  
 21840                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21841                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 21842                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 21843                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 21844                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 21845                                  ;out: devmark established.
 21846                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 21847                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 21848                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21849                                  
 21850                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21851                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 21852                                  
 21853                                  setdevmark:
 21854                                  
 21855 00001411 06                      	push	es
 21856 00001412 51                      	push	cx
 21857                                  
 21858 00001413 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 21859 00001418 2E890E[3214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 21860 0000141D 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 21861                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21862                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 21863 0000141F 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 21864 00001423 41                      	inc	cx
 21865                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 21866 00001424 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 21867                                  
 21868 00001429 59                      	pop	cx
 21869 0000142A 07                      	pop	es
 21870 0000142B 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 21871 00001430 C3                      	retn

 22074                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22075                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22076                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22077                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="

 22109                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22110 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22111 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22112 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22113                                  endstruc
 22114                                  
 22115                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22116                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22117                                  ;
 22118                                  ;
 22119                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22120                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22121                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22122                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22123                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22124                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22125                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22126                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22127                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22128                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22129                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22130                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22131                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22132                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22133                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22134                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22135                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22136                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22137                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22138                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22139                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22140                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22141                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22142                                  ;	   :
 22143                                  ;
 22144                                  ;Note:
 22145                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22146                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22147                                  ;
 22148                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22149                                  ;
 22150                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22151                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22152                                  ;
 22153                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22154                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22155                                  ;
 22156                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22157                                  ;
 22158                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22159                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22160                                  ;
 22161                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22162                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22163                                  ;
 22164                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22165                                  ;
 22166                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22167                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22168                                  ;
 22169                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22170                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22171                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22172                                  ;
 22173                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22174                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22175                                  ;
 22176                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22177                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22178                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22179                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22180                                  
 22181                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22182                                  
 22183                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22184                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22185                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22186                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22187                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22188                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22189                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22190                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22191                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22192                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22193                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22194                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22195                                  
 22196                                  ;**** Function flags
 22197                                  
 22198                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22199                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22200                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22201                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22202                                  
 22203                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22204                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22205 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22206 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22207 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22208 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22209 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22210 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22211                                  endstruc
 22212                                  
 22213                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22214                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22215                                  ;
 22216                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22217                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22218                                  ;	     +-
 22219                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22220                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22221                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22222                                  ;	     |	:
 22223                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22224                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22225                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22226                                  ;	     |	:
 22227                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22228                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22229                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22230                                  ;	     +-	:
 22231                                  ;
 22232                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22233                                  ;
 22234                                  ;Note:
 22235                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22236                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22237                                  ;
 22238                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22239                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22240                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22241                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22242                                  
 22243                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22244                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22245                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22246                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22247                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22248                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22249                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22250                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22251                                  
 22252                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22253 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22254 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22255 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22256 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22257 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22258                                  endstruc
 22259                                  
 22260                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22261                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22262                                  ;
 22263                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22264                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22265                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22266                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22267                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22268                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22269                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22270                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22271                                  ;
 22272                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22273                                  ;
 22274                                  ;            +-
 22275                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22276                                  ;	    | or
 22277                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22278                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22279                                  ;	    | or
 22280                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22281                                  ;	    | or
 22282                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22283                                  ;	    | or
 22284                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22285                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22286                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22287                                  ;	    | or
 22288                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22289                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22290                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22291                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22292                                  ;	    +-
 22293                                  ;
 22294                                  ;
 22295                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22296                                  ;      list.
 22297                                  ;
 22298                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22299                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22300                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22301                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22302                                  
 22303                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22304                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22305 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22306 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22307 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22308 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22309                                  endstruc

 22424                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22425                                  ; SysParse;
 22426                                  ;
 22427                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22428                                  ;
 22429                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22430                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22431                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22432                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22433                                  ;
 22434                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22435                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22436                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22437                                  ;
 22438                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22439                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22440                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22441                                  ;
 22442                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22443                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22444                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22445                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22446                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22447                                  ;
 22448                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22449                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22450                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22451                                  ;
 22452                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22453                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22454                                  ;
 22455                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22456                                  ;
 22457                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22458                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22459                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22460                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22461                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22462                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22463                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22464                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22465                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22466                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22467                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22468                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22469                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22470                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22471                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22472                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22473                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22474                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22475                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22476                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22477                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22478                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22479                                  ;					  (tm12)

 22481                                  ;					  (tm13)

 22483                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22484                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22485                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22486                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22487

 22489                                  
 22490                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22491                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22492                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22493                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22494                                  
 22495                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22496                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22497                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22498                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22499                                  ;
 22500                                  
 22501                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22502                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22503                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22504                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22505                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22506                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22507                                  
 22508                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22509                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22510                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22511                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22512                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22513                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22514                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22515                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22516                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22517                                  
 22518                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22519                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22520                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22521                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22522                                  ;	     segment.
 22523

 22526                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020

 22528                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in

 22632                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.

 23059                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23060                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23061                                  ;
 23062                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23063                                  ;
 23064                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23065                                  ;	    AL = type
 23066                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23067                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23068                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23069                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23070                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23071                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23072                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23073                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23074                                  ;
 23075                                  ; Output:   None
 23076                                  ;
 23077                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23078                                  ;
 23079                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23080                                  ;***********************************************************************

 23294                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 23295                                  ;
 23296                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 23297                                  ;
 23298                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 23299                                  ;
 23300                                  ; Output:   None
 23301                                  ;
 23302                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS
 23303                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23304                                  
 23305                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 23306 00001846 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23307 00001847 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23308                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 23309 00001848 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23310 0000184B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23311 0000184D 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 23312                                  
 23313 0000184F 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 23314 00001851 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 23315                                  
 23316 00001853 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 23317 00001858 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 23318                                  
 23319 0000185A 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 23320 0000185E EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 23321                                  
 23322                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 23323 00001860 E81904                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 23324 00001863 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 23325                                  
 23326 00001865 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 23327                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 23328 00001866 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 23329 00001867 EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 23330                                  
 23331                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 23332 00001869 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 23333 0000186A 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23334 0000186B C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 23336                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23337                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 23338                                  ;
 23339                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 23340                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 23341                                  ;
 23342                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 23343                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 23344                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 23345                                  ;
 23346                                  ; Output:   None
 23347                                  ;
 23348                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23349                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23350                                  
 23351                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 23352 0000186C 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23353 0000186D 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23354 0000186E 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 23355                                  
 23356                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 23357 00001870 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 23358 00001873 E80604                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 23359 00001876 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 23360                                  
 23361 00001878 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23362 0000187A 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 23363                                  
 23364 0000187C E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 23365 0000187F 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 23366 00001882 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next

 23713                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23714                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 23715                                  ;
 23716                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 23717                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 23718                                  ;
 23719                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 23720                                  ;
 23721                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 23722                                  ;
 23723                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 23724                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23725                                  
 23726                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23727                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 23728 000019D4 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 23729 000019D5 2EF606[4714]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 23730 000019DB 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 23731                                  
 23732 000019DD 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 23733 000019DE C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 23734                                  
 23735                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 23736 000019DF 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 23737 000019E0 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 23738                                  
 23739 000019E2 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 23740 000019E3 C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 23741                                  
 23742                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 23743                                  _$P_0099Err: ; 14/08/2023
 23744 000019E4 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 23745                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 14/08/2023
 23746 000019E5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 23747                                  
 23748                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23749                                  ; _$P_0099;
 23750                                  ;
 23751                                  ; Function:  Make ASCII 0-9 to Binary 0-9
 23752                                  ;
 23753                                  ; Input:     AL = character code
 23754                                  ;
 23755                                  ; Output:    CY = 1 : AL is not number
 23756                                  ;	     CY = 0 : AL contains binary value
 23757                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23758
