 24448                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24449                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24450                                  ;
 24451                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24452                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24453                                  ;
 24454                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24455                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24456                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24457                                  ;
 24458                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24459                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24460                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24461                                  
 24462                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24463                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24464                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24465                                  ;
 24466                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24467                                  
 24468                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24469                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24470                                  
 24471                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24472                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24473                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24474                                  	; 14/08/2023
 24475 00001C63 BD[5014]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 24476                                  
 24477                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24478 00001C66 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24479 00001C68 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24480                                  
 24481                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24482 00001C6A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24483 00001C6C 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24484                                  
 24485 00001C6E F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24486                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24487                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24488 00001C6F C3                      	retn
 24489                                  
 24490                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24491                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24492                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24493                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24494                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24495                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24496                                  
 24497                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24498                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24499 00001C70 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24500 00001C72 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24501                                  
 24502 00001C74 2E800E[4714]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24503                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24504                                  
 24505                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24506                                  	; cf=0
 24507                                  	;retn
 24508                                  
 24509                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24510                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24511                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24512 00001C7A F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24513                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24514                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24515 00001C7B C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24516                                  
 24517                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24518                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24519                                  ;
 24520                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24521                                  ;
 24522                                  ;  Input:
 24523                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24524                                  ;
 24525                                  ;  Output:
 24526                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24527                                  ;
 24528                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24529                                  ;
 24530                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24531                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24532                                  
 24533                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24534 00001C7C 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24535 00001C7D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24536 00001C7E 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24537                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24538                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24539                                  	; 14/08/2023
 24540 00001C7F 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 24541 00001C84 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 24542 00001C86 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 24543 00001C88 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24544 00001C89 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24545 00001C8A 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24546 00001C8B 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24547 00001C8C 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24548 00001C8D 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24549 00001C8E 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24550                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 24551                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24552 00001C8F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 24553 00001C91 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24554 00001C94 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24555                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24556 00001C96 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24557 00001C98 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24558 00001C9A 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24559 00001C9B 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24560 00001C9C 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24561 00001C9D 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24562 00001C9E 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24563 00001C9F 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24564 00001CA0 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24565 00001CA1 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24566                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24567 00001CA3 2E8936[4214]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24568 00001CA8 2E891E[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24569                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24570                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24571                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24572                                  	; 14/08/2023
 24573 00001CAD 2EC536[4214]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 24574                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24575 00001CB2 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24576 00001CB5 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24577 00001CB7 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24578 00001CB9 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24579 00001CBB 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24580 00001CBE 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24581 00001CC0 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24582 00001CC1 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24583                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24584 00001CC3 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24585 00001CC4 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24586                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24587 00001CC5 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24588                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24589                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24590                                  	; cf=0
 24591                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24592                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24593 00001CC7 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24594 00001CC8 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;

 24608                                  struc p_parms
 24609 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 24610 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 24611 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 24612 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 24613                                  .size:
 24614                                  endstruc
 24615                                  
 24616                                  struc p_pos
 24617 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 24618 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 24619 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 24620                                  
 24621                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 24622                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 24623                                  
 24624 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 24625 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 24626                                  .size:
 24627                                  endstruc
 24628                                  
 24629                                  struc	p_range
 24630 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 24631 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 24632 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 24633 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 24634 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 24635                                  .size:
 24636                                  endstruc

 25151                                  
 25152                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25153                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25154                                  
 25155                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25156                                  ;
 25157                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25158                                  ;
 25159                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25160                                  ;
 25161                                  ;   Modification log:
 25162                                  ;
 25163                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25164                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25165                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25166                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25167                                  ;
 25168                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25169                                  ;
 25170                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25171                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25172                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25173                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25174                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25175                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25176                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25177                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25178                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25179                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25180                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25181                                  ;
 25182                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25183                                  
 25184                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25185                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25186                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25187                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25188                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25189                                  
 25190                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25191                                  
 25192                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25193                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25194                                  
 25195                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25196                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25197                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25198                                  
 25199                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25200                                  ;
 25201                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25202                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25203                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25204                                  ;	           line.
 25205                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25206                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25207                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25208                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25209                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25210                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25211                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25212                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25213                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25214                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25215                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25216                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25217                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25218                                  ;	           for details).
 25219                                  
 25220                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25221                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25222                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25223                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25224                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25225                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25226                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25227                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25228                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25229                                  
 25230                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25231                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25232                                  
 25233                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25234                                  
 25235                                  %endif
 25236                                  
 25237                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 25292                                  ; procedure : doconf
 25293                                  ;

 25299                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25300                                  doconf:
 25301 00001EE1 0E                      	push	cs
 25302 00001EE2 1F                      	pop	ds
 25303                                  
 25304 00001EE3 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 25305                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 25306 00001EE6 CD21                    	int	21h
 25307 00001EE8 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 25308                                  
 25309                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25310                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25311                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 25312                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 25313                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25314                                  
 25315 00001EEC BA[C433]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 25316 00001EEF B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 25317                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 25318 00001EF2 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25319 00001EF3 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25320 00001EF5 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 25321                                  
 25322                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25323                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25324                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 25325                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 25326                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 25327 00001EF7 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 25328 00001EFC C3                      	retn
 25329                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 25330 00001EFD 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 25331 00001EFF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25332 00001F01 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25333                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 25334 00001F03 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 25335 00001F06 CD21                    	int	21h
 25336 00001F08 A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 25337                                  
 25338 00001F0B 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25339                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 25340 00001F0D B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 25341 00001F10 CD21                    	int	21h
 25342                                  
 25343                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25344                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25345 00001F12 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25346                                  
 25347 00001F16 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25348 00001F19 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25349 00001F1C E8A1F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25350 00001F1F 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25351                                  
 25352                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25353                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25354                                  ;;
 25355                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25356                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25357                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25358                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25359                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25360                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25361                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25362                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25363                                  ;;
 25364                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25365                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25366                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25367                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25368                                  
 25369 00001F21 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25370                                  	
 25371                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25372                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25373                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25374 00001F24 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25375 00001F28 E8ABEC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25376                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25377                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25378 00001F2B 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25379                                   
 25380 00001F30 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25381 00001F32 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25382                                  
 25383 00001F34 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25384 00001F36 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25385 00001F3B B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25386                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25387 00001F3D F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25388 00001F3E CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25389 00001F40 9C                      	pushf
 25390                                  
 25391                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25392                                  
 25393 00001F41 50                      	push	ax
 25394 00001F42 57                      	push	di
 25395 00001F43 51                      	push	cx
 25396 00001F44 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25397 00001F46 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25398 00001F48 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25399 00001F4A F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25400 00001F4C 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25401                                  
 25402                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25403                                  
 25404 00001F4E 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25405                                  
 25406                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25407                                  
 25408                                  puteol:
 25409 00001F4F B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25410 00001F51 AA                      	stosb
 25411 00001F52 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25412 00001F54 AA                      	stosb
 25413 00001F55 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25414                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25415                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25416                                  
 25417                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25418                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25419 00001F57 0E                      	push	cs
 25420 00001F58 1F                      	pop	ds
 25421                                  
 25422 00001F59 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25423                                  
 25424 00001F5D 59                      	pop	cx
 25425 00001F5E 5F                      	pop	di
 25426 00001F5F 58                      	pop	ax
 25427                                  
 25428                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25429                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25430                                  	;push	cs
 25431                                  	;pop	ds
 25432                                  
 25433 00001F60 50                      	push	ax
 25434                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25435 00001F61 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25436 00001F63 CD21                    	int	21h
 25437 00001F65 58                      	pop	ax
 25438 00001F66 9D                      	popf
 25439 00001F67 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25440 00001F69 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25441 00001F6B 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25442                                  conferr:
 25443 00001F6D BA[C433]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25444 00001F70 E8A813                  	call	badfil
 25445                                  endconv:
 25446 00001F73 C3                      	retn
 25447                                  
 25448                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25449                                  ;
 25450                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25451                                  ;
 25452                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands

 25457                                  multi_pass:

 25467 00001F7D FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25468 00001F81 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25469                                  
 25470 00001F82 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]

 25504                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25505                                  
 25506                                          push    ax                      ;
 25507                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25508                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25509                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25510                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25511                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25512                                          pop     ax
 25513                                  ;
 25514                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25515                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25516                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25517                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25518                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25519                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25520                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25521                                  ;   spot.
 25522                                  ;
 25523                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25524                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25525                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25526                                  ;   retrieved.
 25527                                  ;
 25528                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25529                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25530                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25531                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25532                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25533                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25534                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25535                                  final:                                  ;
 25536                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25537                                  not_final:                              ;
 25538                                  ;endif
 25539                                  
 25540                                  %endif

 25708                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25709                                  ;									      *
 25710                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 25711                                  ;									      *
 25712                                  ; input :								      *
 25713                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 25714                                  ; output:								      *
 25715                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 25716                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 25717                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 25718                                  ;									      *
 25719                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 25720                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 25721                                  ; logic:								      *
 25722                                  ; {									      *
 25723                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 25724                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 25725                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 25726                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 25727                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 25728                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 25729                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 25730                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 25731                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 25732                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 25733                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 25734                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 25735                                  ;	};								      *
 25736                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 25737                                  ; };									      *
 25738                                  ;									      *
 25739                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25740                                  
 25741                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25742                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 25743                                  tryb:
 25744 0000201A 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 25745 0000201D 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 25746                                  
 25747                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25748                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 25750                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25751                                  ;;endif

 25754                                  	; 18/12/2022

 25828                                  ; break command
 25829                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25830                                  
 25831                                  ;****************************************************************************
 25832                                  ;									    *
 25833                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 25834                                  ;									    *
 25835                                  ; input :								    *
 25836                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 25837                                  ; output:								    *
 25838                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 25839                                  ;									    *
 25840                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 25841                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 25842                                  ; logic:								    *
 25843                                  ; {									    *
 25844                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 25845                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 25846                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 25847                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 25848                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 25849                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 25850                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 25851                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 25852                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 25853                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 25854                                  ;	};								    *
 25855                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 25856                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 25857                                  ; };									    *
 25858                                  ;									    *
 25859                                  ;****************************************************************************
 25860                                  
 25861                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25862                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 25863                                  tryc:
 25864 00002076 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 25865 00002079 7534                    	jne	short trym
 25866                                  
 25867                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25868                                  ;;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG
 25869                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25870                                  ;       jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25871                                  ;;endif
 25872 0000207B BF[1C1D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 25873 0000207E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25874                                  	; 04/01/2023
 25875                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 25876                                  do22:
 25877 00002080 E82506                  	call	sysinit_parse
 25878 00002083 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 25879                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 25880                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 25881                                  	; 31/12/2022
 25882                                  ;sr22:
 25883                                  	;jmp	coff
 25884                                  	; 04/01/2023
 25885 00002085 E99E05                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 25886                                  if22:
 25887 00002088 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 25888 0000208B 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 25889                                  
 25890                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 25891 0000208D 803E[151D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 25892 00002092 7507                    	jne	short if26
 25893                                  
 25894 00002094 C606[411D]01            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],1	; turn it on
 25895                                  	;jmp	short en26
 25896                                  	; 31/12/2022

 25904 000020A4 B001                    	mov	al,1

 25913                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25914                                  ; multitrack command
 25915                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25916                                  
 25917                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25918                                  ;									      *
 25919                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 25920                                  ;									      *
 25921                                  ; input :								      *
 25922                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 25923                                  ; output:								      *
 25924                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 25925                                  ;									      *
 25926                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 25927                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 25928                                  ; logic:								      *
 25929                                  ; {									      *
 25930                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 25931                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 25932                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 25933                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 25934                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 25935                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 25936                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 25937                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 25938                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 25939                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 25940                                  ;	};								      *
 25941                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 25942                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *
 25943                                  ;									      *
 25944                                  ; };									      *
 25945                                  ;									      *

 27254                                  
 27255                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27256                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27257                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27258                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27259                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27260                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27261                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27262                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27263                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27264                                  
 27265                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27266                                  ;									  *
 27267                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27268                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27269                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27270                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27271                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27272                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27273                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27274                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27275                                  ; input :								  *
 27276                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27277                                  ; output:								  *
 27278                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27279                                  ;									  *
 27280                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27281                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27282                                  ; logic:								  *
 27283                                  ; {									  *
 27284                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27285                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27286                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27287                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27288                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27289                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27290                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27291                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27292                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27293                                  ;	     }								  *
 27294                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27295                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27296                                  ;	};								  *
 27297                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27298                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27299                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27300                                  ; };									  *
 27301                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27302                                  
 27303                                  tryk:

 27970                                  sysinit_parse:
 27971                                  
 27972                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27973                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 27974                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 27975                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 27976                                  ;
 27977                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 27978                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 27979                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 27980                                  ;	*** after each call.
 27981                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 27982                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 27983                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 27984                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 27985                                  ;	 procedure.
 27986                                  ;	ax - exit code
 27987                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 27988                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 27989                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 27990                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 27991                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27992                                  
 27993                                  	; 24/10/2022

 28204                                  ; procedure : showlinenum
 28205                                  ;
 28206                                  ; convert the binary linecount to decimal ascii string in showcount
 28207                                  ; and display showcount at the current curser position.
 28208                                  ; in.) linecount
 28209                                  ;
 28210                                  ; out) the number is printed.
 28211                                  ;
 28212                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 28222                                  
 28223 0000271E 0E                      	push	cs
 28224 0000271F 07                      	pop	es		; es=cs
 28225                                  
 28226                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28227                                  	;push	cs
 28228                                  	;pop	ds
 28229                                  
 28230 00002720 BF[3103]                	mov	di,showcount+4	; di -> the least significant decimal field.
 28231 00002723 B90A00                  	mov	cx,10		; decimal divide factor
 28232                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:linecount]
 28233                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28234 00002726 A1[2B03]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 28235                                  sln_loop:
 28236                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28237 00002729 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; < 10 ?
 28238                                  	;cmp	ax,10		; < 10?
 28239 0000272B 720C                    	jb	short sln_last
 28240                                  
 28241 0000272D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 28242 0000272F F7F1                    	div	cx	; cx = 10
 28243 00002731 80CA30                  	or	dl,30h		; add "0" (= 30h) to make it an ascii.
 28244 00002734 8815                    	mov	[di],dl
 28245 00002736 4F                      	dec	di
 28246 00002737 EBF0                    	jmp	short sln_loop
 28247                                  
 28248                                  sln_last:

 28250 0000273B 8805                    	mov	[di],al
 28251 0000273D 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28252 0000273F E8050C                  	call	print		; show it.
 28253 00002742 5F                      	pop	di
 28254                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28255                                  	;pop	ds
 28256 00002743 07                      	pop	es

 28315                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28316                                  ;
 28317                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28318                                  ;
 28319                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28320                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28321                                  ;
 28322                                  ;	Output : none
 28323                                  ;
 28324                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28325                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28326                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28327                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28328                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28329                                  ;
 28330                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28331                                  
 28332                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28333                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28334                                  	; ds = cs
 28335 00002768 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 28336                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28337                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28338 0000276B E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28339 0000276E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28340                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28341                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28342                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28343                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28344                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28345                                  	; ds = cs
 28346 00002770 803E[CB1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28347 00002775 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28348 00002777 A1[B21E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28349                                  lim_set:
 28350                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28351                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28352                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28353                                  ;limx:
 28354                                  	;retn
 28355                                  	
 28356                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28357                                  
 28358                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28359                                  ;
 28360                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28361                                  ;
 28362                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28363                                  ;	Output : none
 28364                                  ;
 28365                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28366                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28367                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28368                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28369                                  ;
 28370                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28371                                  
 28372                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28373                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28374 0000277A 1E                      	push	ds
 28375 0000277B BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28376 0000277E 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28377 00002780 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28378 00002784 2E891E[CF1E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28379 00002789 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28380 0000278B D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28381 0000278D A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28382 00002790 2EC606[CE1E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28383 00002796 1F                      	pop	ds
 28384                                  ;limx:
 28385 00002797 C3                      	retn
 28386                                  
 28387                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28388                                  ;
 28389                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28390                                  ;
 28391                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28392                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28393                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28394                                  ;
 28395                                  ;	Output : none
 28396                                  ;
 28397                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28398                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28399                                  ;
 28400                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28401                                  
 28402                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28403                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28404                                  	; ds = cs
 28405 00002798 803E[CE1E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28406                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28407                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28408                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28409 0000279D 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28410                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28411 0000279F B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28412 000027A2 8826[CE1E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28413                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28414                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28415 000027A6 1E                      	push	ds
 28416                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28417 000027A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28418 000027A9 2EA1[CF1E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28419 000027AD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28420 000027B0 1F                      	pop	ds
 28421                                  timx:
 28422 000027B1 C3                      	retn
 28423                                  
 28424                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28425                                  ;
 28426                                  ; procedure : IsIt3Com?
 28427                                  ;
 28428                                  ;	Input : DevEntry = Seg:0 of device driver
 28429                                  ;	Output : Zero flag set if device name is 'PROTMAN$'
 28430                                  ;		 else Zero flag is reset
 28431                                  ;
 28432                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28433                                  
 28434                                  IsIt3Com:
 28435                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28436                                  	; ds = cs
 28437 000027B2 1E                      	push	ds
 28438 000027B3 06                      	push	es
 28439 000027B4 56                      	push	si
 28440                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28441 000027B5 C536[B41E]              	lds	si,[DevEntry]
 28442                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 28443 000027B9 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 28444 000027BC 0E                      	push	cs
 28445 000027BD 07                      	pop	es
 28446 000027BE BF[D11E]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 28447 000027C1 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 28448 000027C4 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 28449 000027C6 5E                      	pop	si
 28450 000027C7 07                      	pop	es
 28451 000027C8 1F                      	pop	ds
 28452 000027C9 C3                      	retn
 28453

 28462 000027D1 2E8B1E[A302]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]

 28471                                  
 28472                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 28475                                  
 28476                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28477                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28478                                  
 28479                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28480                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28481                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28482                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28483                                  
 28484                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28485                                  ;
 28486                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28487                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28488                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28489                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28490                                  ;
 28491                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28492                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28493                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28494                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28495                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28496                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28497                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28498                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28499                                  ; available during the load.
 28500                                  ;
 28501                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28502                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28503                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28504                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28505                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28506                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28507                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28508                                  ;
 28509                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28510                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28511                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28512                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28513                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28514                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28515                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28516                                  ;
 28517                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28518                                  
 28519                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28520                                  
 28521                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28522                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28523                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28524                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28525                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28526                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28527                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28528                                  
 28529                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28530                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28531                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28532                                  
 28533                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28534                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 28535                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28536                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 28537                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 28538                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 28539                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28540                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28541                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 28542                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 28543                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28544                                  
 28545                                  InitVar:
 28546                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 28547                                  	push	ax
 28548                                  	push	cx
 28549                                  	push	di
 28550                                  	push	es
 28551                                  
 28552                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 28553                                  	push	cs
 28554                                  	pop	es
 28555                                  
 28556                                  	xor	ax,ax
 28557                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 28558                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 28559                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 28560                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 28561                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 28562                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 28563                                  
 28564                                  	cld
 28565                                  
 28566                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 28567                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 28568                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 28569                                  
 28570                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 28571                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 28572                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 28573                                  
 28574                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 28575                                  
 28576                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 28577                                  	pop	es
 28578                                  	pop	di
 28579                                  	pop	cx
 28580                                  	pop	ax	 	
 28581                                  
 28582                                  	retn
 28583                                  
 28584                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28585                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 28586                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28587                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 28588                                  ; EXIT    : None
 28589                                  ; ERROR   : None
 28590                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 28591                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28592                                  
 28593                                  FixMem:
 28594                                  	push	ax
 28595                                  	push	bx
 28596                                  	push	cx
 28597                                  	push	dx
 28598                                  	push	es
 28599                                  
 28600                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 28601                                  
 28602                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 28603                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 28604                                  
 28605                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 28606                                  
 28607                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 28608                                  
 28609                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 28610                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 28611                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 28612                                  
 28613                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28614                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 28615                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 28616                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28617                                  
 28618                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 28619                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 28620                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 28621                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 28622                                  
 28623                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 28624                                  
 28625                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 28626                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 28627                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 28628                                  
 28629                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 28630                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 28631                                  	; 14/08/2023
 28632                                  	inc	bx
 28633                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 28634                                  
 28635                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 28636                                  
 28637                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 28638                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 28639                                  
 28640                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 28641                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 28642                                  	inc	bx
 28643                                  	mov	es,bx
 28644                                  
 28645                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 28646                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 28647                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 28648                                  fmX:	
 28649                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 28650                                  
 28651                                  	pop	es
 28652                                  	pop	dx
 28653                                  	pop	cx
 28654                                  	pop	bx
 28655                                  	pop	ax
 28656                                  
 28657                                  	retn
 28658                                  
 28659                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28660                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 28661                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28662                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 28663                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 28664                                  ; ERROR:    None
 28665                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 28666                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28667                                  
 28668                                  fm_link:
 28669                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 28670                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 28671                                  
 28672                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 28673                                  	;
 28674                                  	;push	es
 28675                                  	;push	cs
 28676                                  	;pop	es
 28677                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 28678                                  	;pop	es
 28679                                  	
 28680                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 28681                                  
 28682                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 28683                                  	mov	bx,1
 28684                                  	int	21h
 28685                                  	retn
 28686                                  
 28687                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28688                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 28689                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28690                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 28691                                  ; EXIT:     None
 28692                                  ; ERROR:    None
 28693                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 28694                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28695                                  
 28696                                  fm_unlink:
 28697                                  	xor	bx,bx
 28698                                  	
 28699                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 28700                                  	;
 28701                                  	;push	ds
 28702                                  	;push	cs
 28703                                  	;pop	ds
 28704                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 28705                                  	;pop	ds
 28706                                  	
 28707                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 28708                                  
 28709                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 28710                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 28711                                  	retn
 28712                                  
 28713                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28714                                  
 28715                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28716                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 28717                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
